loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun, a 38-year-old woman residing in Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, is the mother of a child enrolled in a public primary school. To earn a living, Choeun has been making bamboo baskets and other containers from her home, a skill she learned from her parents, since 2000. She sells her products to tradesmen who send them to international marketplaces.

Choeun is requesting this loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband, an outdoor worker, who often needs to use motor-taxi services. The savings in transport fares will help improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been farming in the Kitale area for 30 years with her farm producing maize and beans for the local market. She carries out her farming with the help of one farmhand and also runs a cereals retail shop in the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit for her new venture. She says she wants to diversify her farming business due to the challenges of poor prices for milk and other dairy products occasioned by stiff competition in the industry.

Mary aspires to own over 2000 birds in her farm.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Reshon

texts.en:
In 2007, ReShon was hit with economic hard times with a layoff from a previous employer, and decided to give entrepreneurship a try. She then put her passion for fashionable accessories and previous experience in online sales and e-commerce to use by starting a business. ReShon now owns Angel Handbags LLC, an online retailer for designer handbags and accessories. Her niche is in a limited number of up-and-coming designers, animal/eco friendly products, and the right combination of search optimization with shopping sites presence. 

ReShon is using this loan to purchase inventory for 2012 and invest in marketing for sales growth. Check out the website here: 

http://www.angelhandbags.com/

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the upcoming 2012 season.

loans.name: Kely

texts.es: Kely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun, es dueña de una Ferretería, es soltera y no tiene hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, agradece a Finca Perú por todas las enseñanzas que le brindaron, aunque es joven siempre trabajo y se esforzó para poder tener todo lo que tiene, las capitaciones le ayudaron a poder formarse como empresaria, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fierros y cemento, lo que desea es poder tener una sucursal.
texts.en: Kely is a member of the Community Bank Llamkasum, she owns a hardware shop, she is single and has no children. She has worked with Finca Peru for four years, is thankful to Finca Peru for all the coaching provided, even though she is young, she has always worked hard to get what she wants, the loans helped her to become an entrepreneur, now she wants to invest this credit in buying iron and cement, her wish is to have a franchise.

loans.use: To buy iron and cement for hardware shop

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 29 years old and married to a cobbler. She has four children, between the ages of 3 and 9, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Valentine sells shoes and she has been running this business for the past nine years. With this loan she plans to purchase more shoes to resell. With the profits she plans to pay the school fees for her children. In the future, Valentine wants to be the sole supplier of shoes in the local markets nearby.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: LINLINGNON est un groupement composé de vingt personnes qui sont des amies. Étiennette, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 56 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Étiennette est une veuve et n'a pas d'enfant. Étiennette vit seule. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Étiennette . Pour y arriver, Étiennette  vend des noix de palme à son domicile depuis trente huit ans. Étiennette vend également de l'huile de palme et prépare du gari (farine de manioc) qu'elle revend par la suite.Étiennette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Étiennette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LINLINGNON un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme, de l'huile de palme et du manioc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and a single mother of three children. Two are in primary school and the first born has been admitted to a teachers college. She has been very active in the group meetings and has been able to clear previous loans she received from the group.

She is a regular customer because she has borrowed a loan for four rounds and is very diligent about servicing the loans in good time. She is trusted by her group members. Nancy is a hardworking lady and has been able to meet her family needs through farming. She grows tea leaves and Napier grass which are her main source of income. She also grows food for domestic use. Nancy is employed in a local hotel where the earnings she receives have enabled her to rent a plot of land and plant tea to substitute the family income.

With the hope of securing a loan, her son will be able to join the college, thus relieving the burden from her shoulders. She believes that educating her children is an investment. Repaying of the loan in installments will enable her to maintain other activities focused on her family.

loans.use: Nancy wants to pay college fees for her son.

loans.name: Gurbat

texts.en: Gurbat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He started his business five years ago selling clothing, bags and other apparel items. The business has been growing and he is requesting a loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Tausaga

texts.en: Tausaga has been married only a few months, but neither she nor her husband have ever had steady employment.  Tausaga used an initial loan from SPBD to purchase seed and supplies to plant a vegetable and fruit garden.  She has been raising cabbages, cucumbers, peas, tomatoes and pineapples.  She hopes to grow this small farm into a reliable income stream. Tausaga has her first loan in full and on time, She is now eligible for a home improvement loan.  Tausaga lives with her husband in a small, open Samoan house.  She is very anxious to build a proper house for her future children.

loans.use: Build house for her family

loans.name: Manuela Janeth

texts.es:
Manuela is 26 years old. She is a young entrepreneur and an overachiever. She is single and attending college. She already works for a company and, recently, purchased her own home - mortgage payments are deducted from her paycheck. She began selling shoes through catalog order only two years ago to pay for college expenses. The biggest forces behind the growth of her business are enthusiasm and her will to grow.

Now she needs a $250.00 loan so that she can purchase merchandise to satisfy her clients’ demands. She commits to paying back her loan within 3 months. You could help Manuela achieve her goals. Do not let her dreams be interrupted. Thank you very much for trusting and for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuela tiene 26 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera, está estudiando su carrera universitaria y trabaja en una empresa, recientemente ha adquirido su casa propia, que le descuentan por nómina. Para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace dos años, el entusiasmo y las ganas que tiene de salir adelante han sido el impulso más grande que tiene para hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Manuela necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Manuela, no permitas que sus sueños se vean interrumpidos, muchas gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new products to sell

loans.name: Saipolua

texts.en: Saipolua is the oldest member of Malie Centre.  She is 70 years of age, and a widow with 6 children and 24 grandchildren.  Before her husband passed away, he loved working in their plantation. Apart from that he had a pig farm. This is something Saipolua treasured very much, when her husband died. She wants to make sure everything he sweated for is maintained. This is Saipolua's first loan with SPBD and she has so many plans of what she would like to do with the money when she receives it.  She is a very fit mother, extremely hard working, and she has always believed that hard work is the key to long life.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her barbecue business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stock of paraffin.

loans.name: Churaboy

texts.ru:
Churaboy M. is 58 years old, married, has four children. He has been a client with Microinvest since the beginning of 2005. Sharif has been raising and fattening cattle for sale for more then 15 years. Since nowadays all the farm co-ops have been disbanded, the only farm work that earns a good income for Mr. M. is the fattening of cattle. Mr. M. has used his previous loan from Microinvest to buy calves and after fattening them for 4 month he sold them for double their purchase price. At this time he has more the eight calves on his farm. Mr. M. would like to use this new loan to increase the number of the calves he owns.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мамарофиев Чурабой , возраст- 58 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. Клиент МЗФ «Микроинвест» -а с начала 2005 года.Откормом скота занимается более 15 лет. Так как на данное время все колхозы и совхозы расформированы единственным работой приносящий доход клиенту это откорм скота. Клиент на первый полученный доход купил молодняки и после откорма 4-х месяца продал на удвоенную сумму. Так он на данный момент имеет более 8-и молодняков. Клиент хочет получит новый займ и увеличить число молодняков.

loans.use: Purchase of calves for fattening and sale

loans.name: Brisas Del Lago Panajachel Group

texts.es:
The group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” (which in Spanish means “the Breeze from the Panajachel Lake”) is integrated by eighteen women. All the women in this group show an incredible willpower, they are cheerful and extroverted. They all work in the town of Panajachel where they bring happiness to the community whilst they work in their different activities.

The women in the group are very happy because they will receive the first loan in their lives. With it, they hope to see their businesses flourish and consequently improve their standard of living. Even though this is their first loan, all of them have ventured to ask the highest amount that can be given as an initial loan (263USD per person). They are proud of themselves because it is the first time that someone, in this case Friendship Bridge and Kiva, are betting on them and believe in their capabilities.

Most of them will use the loan to buy and then sell clothing (both new and used) at the market or in the streets. Some will use it to buy ingredients in order to prepare food that they will sell during lunch and diner time. Others will use it to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics. Finally, one of them is a midwife and she will use the money to buy medicines.

The midwife is the town's doctor and she takes care of the deliveries, mostly those of indigenous women. Moreover, she also assists with other sicknesses.

Many of them dream of having their own shops so they don’t have to be street vendors. Others want to pay their first loan in order to show themselves that they are capable of having a good business.

They all dream of having sound businesses that will allow them to count on a steady income and of course, they all dream about the general wellbeing of their families and community.

The women of the group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” only need an initial support so they can move forward, please help them with this credit and they will not let you down. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo de diez y ocho señoras reflejan una fuerza de voluntad increíble, además de ser muy alegres y extrovertidas. Todas ellas trabajan en el pueblo de Panajachel alegrando a la comunidad mientras laboran en sus respectivas empresas.

Las señoras que conforman el grupo están felices porque van a recibir el primer préstamo en sus vidas, ellas tienen la esperanza de que su negocio vaya a florecer y así incrementar sus estándares de vida. A pesar de que este es su primer préstamo, todas las integrantes se van a aventurar a pedir la cantidad más alta que se puede otorgar en un crédito inicial: US$263. Ellas están orgullosas de si mismas ya que por primera vez alguien, Friendship Bridge y Kiva, está apostando por ellas y creen en sus capacidades.

La mayoría van a pedir préstamos para la compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada en el mercado o de manera ambulante. Otras van a pedir para comprar insumos para la venta de almuerzos y comidas. También, hay clientas que venden joyería y cosméticos. Finalmente, en el grupo hay una comadrona que va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar medicinas. La comadrona es la doctora del pueblo que se encarga de los partos de las mujeres indígenas en este caso. Además de asistir con otro tipo de enfermedades.

Muchas de ellas sueñan con tener un local propio ya que venden sus productos como ambulantes. Otras quieren pagar su primer préstamo para poder demostrarse a si mismas que son capaces de tener un buen negocio. También sueñan con tener un negocio estable a lo largo del tiempo para que puedan contar con un ingreso estable. Por supuesto sueñan con tener un bienestar general para su familia y su comunidad.

Las brisas del lago de Panajachel solo necesitan un apoyo inicial para poder salir adelante, apóyenlas con esté crédito y ellas no les fallaran. Gracias

loans.use: The loans will be used in different ways: to buy ingredients to cook and sell food for lunch and dinner, to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics, to buy and sell used clothing at the market or in the streets and to buy medicine

loans.name: Vidalina's Group

texts.en:
Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis have belonged to the community bank “Virgen D. Cocharcas” for nine, three, and six years respectively. They say they joined the community bank because they felt like the leaders had confidence in them. Since joining the community bank they have learned the importance of saving and self-esteem.

Vidalina is 53 years old. She is married and has two children. Vidalina was scared when she joined the community bank, and almost withdrew just a few months after joining. Nine years later she feels much more confident and happy that she has continued to ba a member. Vidalina is an artisan weaver who makes beautiful blankets and other products. She has been weaving for over twenty-five years.

Maximina is 48 years old. She is single and has one child. Maximina raises pigs and has recently started raising guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru. She has been raising animals for two years, before that she sold emoliente, which is a warm beverage maD. from local herbs and seeds.

Gladis is 40 years old. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 18, and 4. Gladis sells coca leaves, which are used for medicinal purposes and to make a delicious tea. Gladis travels to the jungle region to buy the coca leaves and then sells them all around the region of Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis need loans of 1400, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

Their dreams are to start exporting products internationally, to have security old age, and that their children will finish their education.

loans.use: To buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es:
Marisel M. is a very hard working woman who is originally from the county of Achuapa, in the city of Leon, in Nicaragua. She has been a farmer there for many years, and she has her own farmyard in her house. Her young son is very proud to have such a hard working mother, and he has already done a lot towards becoming the best student at his school.

In order to give him a better life style, Marisel looked into ways of improving their situation, and has implemented the use of a solar panal as their community has no electricity, and has to use candles at nightime, which can be dangerous and cause accidental fires. To cancel the debt of the panal she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel as it is the only way forward, and would allow for good use of the panal, and give her son the necessary conditions for his intellectual development.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marisel M. es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio Achuapa de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua el cual se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería teniendo su propio corral en su casa de habitación. Su pequeño hijo se siente muy orgulloso por tener una madre muy trabajadora y ha hecho todo lo posible por ser el mejor alumno en su sección en el colegio donde estudia.

Para brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación y para ello ha implementado un panel solar ya que en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica con que iluminarse sino que ocupan candiles por la noche que hasta cierto punto son muy peligrosos por la exposición a incendios accidentales. Para cancelar la deuda del panel ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel con el único fin de liberar esa deuda y así darle el uso adecuado al panel para continuar proporcionándole las condiciones necesarias a su hijo para que se desarrolle intelectualmente.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para vivienda

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia has had her seamstress business for 6 years. She is 35 years old, married, with two beautiful children ages 16 and 13 who study in school, and her husband is a healthcare aide and he helps with the household expenses. The loan Patricia wants will be used to buy an overlock sewing machine which will allow her improve her product by using the machine to finish her work professionally, resulting in more sales and better working conditions in her shop and being able to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Patricia es una Sra. que ha logrado tener un taller de costura este negocio lo inicio hace seis años, tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 2 hermosos hijos de 16 y 13 años estudiantes, su esposo es auxiliar de enfermería y ayuda con los gastos. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar una maquina Overlock y así mejorar los acabados de los productos para lograr mas ventas y las condiciones en el taller como en su propia economía.

loans.use: buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan Baji is the wife of K. M. and has been living in a city called Riwind in Pakistan for the last 30 years. Rashidan Baji has a milk business. She has two buffaloes. Her husband sells the milk in a shop and earns a profit. Rashidan Baji and her husband are not educated, but they strive for their children and for their education. Her children are settled in their desired work now. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo and sell their milk in a market.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Elizabeth R. H. tengo 29 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo dos hermosos hijos que actualmente estan en la escuela en 2do y 5to grado. , recido en esta comunidad hace unos 9 años. mi nogocio se encuentra en un lugar estrategico para la venta porque estoy muy cerca del centro de educacion basico de Danli, en este momento estoy solicitando ayuda para poder abastecerme de lo necesario para la elaboracion de pan y nacatamales, necesito el dinero para tener mayores ganancias y poder alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante para mi.

loans.use: compra de carnes, verduras, maiz, leña, condimentos, harina, huevos y azucar

loans.name: Habohon

texts.ru:
Habohon A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 45 yeas old, is married and has 4 children. Habohon is a nurse by profession, but since nursing salaries are very small, she purchases and sells vegetables. She has a sales location at the market and has been in this business for 27 years. She purchases vegetables from peasants and resells them at retail prices.

Habohon would like to increase her product assortment. To do this she has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдулоева Хабохон жительница района Шахринав.Возраст 45 лет , замужем ,имеет 4 детей.По образованию медицинская сестра. Но так как заработная плата очень маленькая ,клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей .Она имеет торговую точку на рынке .Занимается этим видом деятельности более 27 лет . Она скупает у крестьян овощи и риелизует в розницу. В данныей момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Но для этого ей нужны деньги .Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija A. is a Tanzanian businesswoman who makes a living selling traditional clothing known locA. as Kanga and Vitenge. She buys wholesale and sells to her customers in a local shopping center and in the Buguruni business market. Her dream is to open and run a real store. She requests a loan of  $325 to buy new supplies and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Rosa viaja 2 veces por semana a la feria del distrito de Chiara en donde vende abarrotes, además Rosa vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja 2 veces por mes, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente. También Rosa vende cosméticos por catalogo.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos. Los sueños de Rosa son tener un local propio donde venda sus productos, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank 'Primavera' (Spring).

Rosa lives with her partner, she's 27 years old and has 3 kids. Rosa travels to the market in the district of Chiara twice a week, where she sells groceries. Rosa also sells clothes according to demands from her friends and family members, and she gets her products in the city of Lima which she travels to twice a month. Her sales are on credit and she charges weekly. Rosa also sells cosmetics from catalogs.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that will be invested in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts. Rosa's dream is to have her own store where she can sell her products, to build a house, and give her kids a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that she will invest in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts/Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 32 years old and lives in the Northern Lebanese city of Tripoli with his parents. He works as a barber and has requested a loan of $1000 in order to redecorate his salon and purchase several new clippers and hair-cutting tools for the business. This will be Rabia's second loan. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new hair-cutting tools and redesign his barbershop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị M. là một phụ nữ không gặp nhiều may mắn trong cuộc sống  do chồng chị  không may mất sớm một mình chị phải nỗ lực để nuôi hai con còn nhỏ. Chị M. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhằm tăng  thu nhập cho gia đình nhưng sau đó nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao nên chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 2000.000đ đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.     
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của bà con địa phương và từ đó tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Chị M. is a woman that has experienced many hardships. Because her husband passed at an early age, she has had to work as a single parent to care for her two young children. Chị M. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. In the beginning, she borrowed capital for rearing livestock to produce income for the family but after a while, she realized that the business did not help them bring in much income. Therefore, she diligently borrowed funds to invest in a retail business selling sundries. Currently their income is 2,000,000 VND and is also the main source of income for the family. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow an additional 9,000,000 VND to purchase more improved personal sundries/items that are in demand and from there increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Esta K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Esta M. from Kyela. She is married with one child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Esta has been running a crops-selling business since 2006. Client’s business is buying crops from farmers and bringing them to town where she can sell them at a higher price.

She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Esta currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more cacao and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of cacao and rice that she buys in bulk. Esta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cacao and rice in bulk

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 57 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their six children on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho. Paulina has a dry goods store in her home. She sells dry goods, vegetables, and meat. She works seven days a week, and her granddaughter helps her run the store. Paulina also travels each week to a market where she sells dry goods and buys oranges.

Paulina needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice, beer, and sugar. Paulina dreams of improving her business and building a home out of bricks and concrete.

loans.use: Buy rice, beer, and sugar

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn M. lives in the Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. She is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Uch Bul, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily V. is from the village of Lullutan, Ilagan, Isabela. The place can only be reached by riding a ferry boat to cross the river. She is 40 years old and married to Camilo, the ferry boat operator in their place of residence. Their marriage was blessed with six children: Victorino - 23 years old; Richard - 22 years old; Gerome - 16 years old; Lea Mae - 14 years old; Shella Mae - 4 years old and Neil - 1 year old. Four of them are high school graduates.

Barbecue vending is Emily's business in their village. She can say that they have average living conditions at present. Even though they are both earning an income, still it is not enough to meet the growing needs of their family. Her loan request of PHP 4,000 will greatly help her in the business. Emily is planning to buy additional products to sell such as snacks and boiled eggs once the loan is granted.

Emily is hoping that all her children will able to pursue their studies. She and her husband will work hard for them to have a better future.

loans.use: Additional products to sell

loans.name: Vinh

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh Thị Vinh 52  tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay sau 5 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được mở rộng hơn với việc chăn nuôi bò và gà thịt. Ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương của chị nên kinh tế khá ổn định với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua 1 con bò và gà giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Đinh Thị Vinh is 52 yrs old.Her family consists of 4 children with 1 still in school. In 2003 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in raising animals. After 5 years of being in the fund, her family's business has expanded to raising cows and chickens. In addition to raising animals, she also has a stable source of income from her own salary so her family's income is stable at 172 USD/month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to purchase 1 additional cow and chickens to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising animals

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his parents. Mohamad has owned a fish and trout shop for ten years. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase food for his fish. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he sells good quality fish. His clients are people from his region and tourists. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase food for his fish.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en: Edmund E. sells spare mechanical parts at Elmina Junction in Elmina. Edmund has received schooling through the university level and has been in business since 2007.  He is single with 5 dependents and holds the primary responsibility for paying his family’s bills.  His loan will be used to buy additional spare parts which will help him expand his business.  Edmund hopes to use his newly gained profits to save and also reinvest back into his business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts which will help him expand his business.

loans.name: Rute

texts.pt:
Rute nasceu em Namaacha tem 35 anos de idade e solteira e  estudou ate a 10ª classe, e mãe de um filho de 14 anos de idade que se encontra a frequentar a 7ª classe.


Rute natural de Namacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia,ela teve que interroper os seus estudos quando começa a trabalhar no Hotel Xissaka como secretária do Director durante 5 anos mas devido a mudança do patronato ela foi uma das excluidas e assim perdeu o emprego. Anos depois os seus sogros mandam a embora do lar alegando que  a sua lingua bamto não era a mesma que a do seu marido e ela perde o lar de tanto la estar a sofrer, no mesmo ano ela e chamada para receber uma indiminizaçao no Hotel Xissaka no valor de 15.000.00mt. entao ela opta em iniciar o seu próprio negócio de venda de roupas diversas adqurida na Africa do Sul e revendidas na  capital. Tem viajado 3 vezes por mês pois tem muitos clientes e conta com muitas encomendas tais com lençois, mantas, duvetes, vasos, cortinas, tapetes etc. tem gasto em cada viagem um valor de 35.000.00mt apois a revenda tem tido de lucro 9.000.00mt, aproxima se a hluvuku quando perde a sua casa num insêndio provocado por um corte circuito na electricidade de moçambique estes que não se responsabilizaram pelo sucedido,Rute pede um emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt a hluvuku  para a manutençao da sua casa. Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua mãe  esta que vive em sua casa emviando lhe em cada 3 meses um valor de 1.000.00mt.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Rute na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt seram usados para comprar material de construção para fazer manutenção da sua casa que foi consumida pelo fogo. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir com o seu salão de cabelereiro.
texts.en:
Rute was born in Namaacha. She is 35 years old, single, and went to school through the 10th grade. She is the mother of a 14 year old son who is in the 7th grade. Rute is a native of Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. She had to interrupt her schooling when she began working in the Hotel Xissaka as the secretary of the Director. She worked there 5 years but due to a change in supervision she was one of the ones excluded, and she lost her job. Years later her in-laws kicked her out of the house alleging that her Bantu language was not the same as that of her husband. She lost her home and was suffering. In the same year she was selected to receive a recompensation from the Hotel Xissaka in the amount of 15,000MT. She decided to begin her own business of selling bedding that she acquired in South Aftica and resold in the Capital. She has travels 3 times each month and has many customers and orders for products like sheets, blankets, duvets, vases, curtains, carpets...etc. She spends 35,000MT with each trip, and after resales she earns 9,000MT. She approached Hluvuku when she lost her home in a fire caused by a short circuit in the wires of Mozambique Electricity, and they would not take responsibility for the accident. Rute is requesting a loan for 15,000MT from Hluvuku to make repairs on her home. Besides her son she is also supporting her mother who lives in her house, and she gives her 1,000MT every three months. This is Rute's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to purchase construction materials to make repairs on her home that was consumed by the fire. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the loan before maturity and request another loan to finish her hair salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Y. is 20 years old. She is married and has given birth to one son who has yet to start school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles like ladies underwear. She hawks to sell and also treks to other towns to sell. Elizabeth procures bales of textiles from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mrs. Eliza is 49 years old and is married to Pedro Chamorro, who is 51 and is an electronics technician. They have a son who is 14 years old and is in eighth grade.

They began selling jewelry on their own, but it didn’t go very well. Then they decided to start a diner about five years ago. The diner is now having very good results. Additionally, Eliza’s husband owns a TV repair shop. They would like to expand their business by adding a small grocery store or a chicken shop to their diner, as they are located in a very populated neighborhood and have many clients.

loans.use: To purchase meat, eggs, bread and drinks

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame Fanta C.  est âgée de 48 ans et vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans le quartier Darsalam, dans une famille monogame, dans la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 6ème (système scolaire Malien) elle commença le petit commerce de jus auprès de sa mère qui avait un réfrigérateur. Après plusieurs années dans ce commerce, elle a maîtrisé les rouages du commerce. Ayant vite compris que les femmes aiment les produits cosmétiques, elle s’est engagée dans cette activité au tout début en faisant le marchandage ambulant de marché en marché. Avec une dizaine année d’activité, elle a ouvert sa boutique  située une artère  très facile d’accès. Très sollicitée et appréciée par les femmes pour sa connaissance des produits et ses conseils dans le choix des articles, Fanta est d’une notoriété très enviable à Ségou.
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis  54 mois. Après  4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 3 ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 cartons de mèches pour les cheveux, 3 cartons de parfums et 2 cartons de cosmétique (skin light) en république  du Sénégal et effectue sa vente toujours au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille. 
Son ambition est  d’avoir une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanta C. is 48 years old and lives with her 7 children and her husband in a monogamous family, in the neighborhood of Darsalam in the city of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of Mali).

She left school in the 6th grade (Malian school system) and started a small business selling juice with her mother, who had a refrigerator. After many years in that business, she mastered the ways of business. Understanding that women love cosmetics, she started this business by selling in the market. After ten years of this activity, she opened a shop in a main thoroughfare which is easy to access. She is very popular and appreciated by the women for her knowledge of the products and advises them about the items they choose; Fanta is wonderfully well-known in Ségou. With the intent of increasing her business, she is working with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has worked for the past 54 months. After 4 group loans and 2 individual loans which were all properly repaid, she is on her third individual loan. She will use this loan to buy 5 boxes of hair extensions, 3 boxes of perfumes and 2 boxes of cosmetics in the Republic of Senegal and will sell them for cash to a mostly female clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for some family expenses. Her goal is to have a house.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for her business.

loans.name: Nellie Fe

texts.en: Nellie Fe J. is from the village of Unidos. She is 38 years old, is engaged, and has four school-aged children. Nellie Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 1999, Nellie Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nellie Fe is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 16th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital

loans.name: Jenny Katherine

texts.es:
"La Sra. Jenny K. C. R., tiene como actividad  la venta de Cds los cuales comercializa en el puesto de su suegra en la populosa Av. Buenos Aires . La unidad económica familiar esta compuesta por su esposo y ella, ya que es una pareja joven.
La cliente fue recomendada por su suegra ya que la misma es cliente de nuestra institución."
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny K. C. R. sells CD’s in her mother-in-law’s stand, which is located on bustling Buenos Aires Avenue. Her family is comprised of two people—Jenny and her husband—because they are still a young couple.

The client was recommended to us by her mother-in-law, who is also a member of our institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a television set

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Embacasy borrower group in Himo,kilimanjaro,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 8,12,15,18,20 years.

Grace started her own business selling Tobaccos 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Grace`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tobaccos for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,grace hopes to save more money,get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more tobaccos

loans.name: Gloria Ysabel

texts.en: Gloria is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 12. They both study at the public school. Gloria studied baking at the Institute of Maria Auxiliadora for five years and worked for some time after that. Next, she decided to sell anticuchos (a Peruvian beef delicacy) and fried chicken out of the front door of her house. Since joining FINCA Peru, Gloria has learned to save and invest, and she says her economic situation is better thanks to FINCA. Gloria needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy ice cream, flour, oil, and chickens. Her dream is to repair her house so that she can use her living room to sell her fried chicken.

loans.use: To buy ice cream, flour, oil, and chickens

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe L. lives in Poblacion, Sindangan. She was married to a layman and blessed with three (3) children. She operates a small grocery store in their community which largely sells primary commodities. Her business was started last 1998 and serves them well as one of their source of livelihood.

She started her membership last October 9, 2007. She has proved to be a good member in the institution since her membership. Recently, she is enjoying her fourth cycle loan.

She is looking forward that she can improve her economic status as she invests more capital in her business.

loans.use: Additional capital on sari-sari.

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
"H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông 03 (3).


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.250.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn T. is from the village of Mohon. She is 47 years old. Nelyn is married. To make a living, Nelyn owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Sandra Zulianita

texts.es:
La señora Z. R. SANDRA ZULIANITA, tiene  28 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DEL MILENIUM II. SANDRA, tiene estudios superiores de Secretariado Ejecutivo, pero como se caso a la edad de 21 años, no pudo ejercer por dedicarse a la crianza de sus pequeños hijos. Tiene 2 hijos y los dos dependen económicamente de ella. La Señora SANDRA se dedica a la atención de sus cabinas de internet y locutorio, durante todo el dia. 
Sandra, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, compro material para la construcción de tres cabinas de internet, y actualmente con su prestamo de 1000.00 nuevos soles, implementará el negocio del Internet y locutorio. Con este préstamo comprara 3 celulares, un tarifador, y dos teléfonos fijos. 
SANDRA, sueña con aperturar otro local dando los servicios de internet y locutorio, en el distrito de El Porvenir, de una zona donde haya mayor movimiento para así poder obtener mayores ganancias, y así brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Z. R. Sandra Zulianita is 28 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, and department of La Libertad, in Peru. Our partner belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres del Milenium II". Sandra has studied in higher education to be an executive secretary, but since she got married at the age of 21 and had to dedicate her time to raising her small children, she was not able to use it. She has 2 children, both of whom depend on her economically. Sandra makes a living attending to her internet and telephone cubicles, all day long. With her first credit of 300.00 nuevos soles, she purchased materials for the construction of 3 internet cubicles, and currently with her loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles, she will set up an internet and telephone business. With this loan she will purchase 3 cell phones, a call accounting system, and 2 landline phones. She dreams of opening another business providing internet and telephone services, in the district of El Porvenir, a zone where there is greater activity, in order to obtain better earnings and provide her children with a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 cell phones, a call accounting system, and 2 landline phones for her business

loans.name: Mohamed Patrick

texts.en:
Mohamed is the proprietor of a Relaxation Bar called M&V and sells liquor and soft drinks. His bar is located by a popular motor park called Shellmingo in BO Town. He is married with two kids, both in nursery school. Before getting into business, Mohamed was a maintenance and supply officer of a gas station, a position he held until his resignation to start up his own business some two years ago.

Mohamed seeks a loan to buy more liquor for his store, buy a piece of land to build his own bar, and take care of his family.

loans.use: buy additional drinks

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M. is from the village of Mambajao, a part of Camiguin Province on the island of Mindanao. She is 35 years old, single and has school-aged children. Marina operates her own stall from which she sells a variety of foods to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to stock new varieties of food so as to expand her offerings. Marina successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP, her second from HSPFI. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to grow her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of food for her food stall.

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Armelinda P., 44, is a resident of Minsubong, Tangub City. She is married to George P. and blessed with 5 children, who are now in their teens and school age. Her husband earns an average net income of just 2,700 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $58 US) from labor and because of this they have experienced hardships in raising their children.  

To help her husband, Armelinda decided to engage in charcoal buying and selling. For 6 years, she was able to sustain it even in times of crisis. Currently she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,600 PHP (about $78 US) a month, which is very helpful in supporting the family. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao: we were named Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

As this is her second loan, Armelinda was allowed to request a loan of 8,000 PHP to add her capital for her business. She will use the future income from this business for her family's daily needs and to save for her children's future.

loans.use: Additional capital for charcoal sales business

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Broulaye Samaké est un homme de 28 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille nucléaire dans le  quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales, il décida d’abandonner l’école coranique pour commencer les activités génératrices de revenus auprès d’un de ses  ami. Il a appris l’achat et la vente des peaux de vaches.
 Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Broulaye Samaké maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, il décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter une grande quantité de peaux de vaches.
Il est à sa première expérience avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les localités environnantes. Sa clientèle est composée de coordonniers et de revendeurs de la sous région.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui servira à subvenir aux besoins et agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Broulaye Samaké is a 28 year old father of one who lives with his wife and child in a nuclear family in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni (the third region of Mali). Due to social reasons he decided to leave Koranic school studies to start earning money from a friend of his. He learnt to buy and sell cowhides. With 8 years' experience, Mr. Broulaye Samaké is very good at his job. In order to access a reliable working capital he decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme to buy a large amount of cowhides. This is his first time with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He buys his stock in Bougouni and in the local area. His customer base is made up of shoemakers and retailers in the subregion. With this loan he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA which will meet his needs and grow his business.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cowhides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk in order to expand her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is from the village of Agoho in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Erlinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients to make products to sell. This will be Erlinda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Yeredeme,  toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, et font le commerce de savons, de l’huile alimentaire, de l’arachide et des céréales.
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de savons de fabrication locale, 60 litres d’huile, des sacs d’arachide et de céréales.
Elles s’approvisionnent en savons avec les fabricants de Fana  et les autres produits sont achetés dans les environnants. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeredeme group, who are all married, are in average 34 yr-old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in N'Tjifina, in the Fana prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family ties, and they trade soap, cooking oil, peanuts and grains. The women of the Yeredeme group are ready for their first group loan, that they will use to buy bags of locally made soaps, 60 liters of oil, bags of peanuts and grains. They purchase their soap supplies from manufacturers in Fana and other products in the surroundings. They retail on markets in Fana and surroundings, to a client base of both women and men that they allow to pay in credit. They expect to each make an average monthly profit of 30.000F CFA that they will use towards health care expenses, food and school fees and the remainder will be re-invested into their business.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various basic goods for retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos L. Sr. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 56 years old and married with six adult children. Carlos operates a fishing business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Carlos has been engaged in his business for over two years and makes approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Carlos joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlos is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing net. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carlos from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing  accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 60 años, es separada y madre de 2 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos y sus nietos. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a  la venta de sus productos de belleza, actividad que lo realiza con mucha alegría, dando una atención de calidad a sus clientes. Ella considera que lo rentable de su trabajo está en la compra al por mayor de los productos y la acumulación de las campañas,  ya que pasada estas ofertas las vende al mismo precio de los catálogos actuales, esa estrategia le permite  acumular más ganancias. Está contenta con lo que hace, ya que caminar y ofrecer  sus productos no lo considera muy trabajoso. Sus planes a futuro es implementar y acondicionar su casa y convertirlo en una tienda de  accesorios de belleza y cosméticos, útiles para cualquier edad. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y promete ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, asimismo desea continuar trabajando  con su grupo solidario, puesto que quiere contar con nuevos aportes en el futuro. El crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza y poder brindar variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is 60 years old, separated and the mother of 2 children. She lives in her own house with her children and her grandchildren. For 12 years she has been selling beauty products, activity she enjoys very much treating her customers excellently. She believes that it is profitable for her work to buy her products wholesale as well as accumulate the campaigns as she can sell the products bought during the campaigns at the current prices established in the catalogs. This strategy gives her higher earnings. She is happy with what she does as walking and offering her products is not hard work for her. Her plans for the future is to implement and condition her house and turn it into a shop selling beauty and cosmetic products to be used at any age. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises to be responsible with the repayments as well as to continue working with her solidarity group as she wishes to count on new contributions in the future. The loan requested will be spent on buying beauty products to offer variety to her customers

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has seen tremendous growth in his retail shop since opening it four years ago. He now wants to diversify and start selling bicycle spare parts.  He operates in the busy Naivasha town.  He is 53 years old, married to Ann Njeri and they have 4 children.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy bicycle parts to sell to diversify his product range.  Bicycles are popular in this part of the country and bicycle owners have to travel far to get spare parts, so Joseph has decided to bring the parts closer to the people.

He hopes to capitalize on the opportunity to be the first seller of bicycle spare parts in his area, and make a profit from the business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra S. is a 52-year-old woman from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. Yusra and her son, Muhammad, and daughter, Fatima, started their disk jockey business two years ago. Yusra's four daughters and her son are college students, so she decided to start her own business to help her husband afford their household expenses.

Yusra bought the DJ equipment to provide music to wedding and parties in the city. Now that her number of clients is growing, she decided to rent a place and work from there, and to purchase modern machines. Therefore she took a $1500 loan from FATEN. The loan will increase her profits and number of clients they can serve, because they are now able to provide services to three clients at the same time.

Yusra and her son, Muhammad, appear in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase DJ machines

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en: In Boeng Kraom village, in Takeo province, these four people make up a group loan. All of the members have selected Mrs. Samoeun L. as a group leader. She and her husband are farmers who own one point seven-hectare plot of land where they can grow crops to sell, to support their family. Now they have a problem because it is time to plow their field. So to improve production, Mrs. Samoeun L. is requesting for a loan to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is helping her to do farming, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To rent a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo 2 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Residenciales El Campo 2 está integrado por tres socias, Reina Isabel P. P., Elbia O. y Santos Blacina P..  Las tres socias viven en Juticalpa, Olancho.  

Señora Reina Isabel P. P. tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda, y tiene 5 hijos.  Comenzó con una mini pulpería hace 12 años con un préstamo de 2,000 Lempiras.  Lo crecí a un mini súper en 2003 pero su esposo se enfermó y tuve que vender su negocio para pagar los gastos médicos.  Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano de forma ambulante.  Tiene una clientela buena y sus hijos le ayuda a vender la ropa.  Con el préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras comprará un fardo de ropa de segundo mano de primera clase.  También usará sus ahorros para comprar tres fardos más.  Con el préstamo podrá crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para suportar a su familia y salir adelante.  Sus sueños son que podrá construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.  

Elbia O. venda verduras y usará el préstamo para comprar verduras por mayor y aumentar sus ganancias.

Santos Blacina P. venda productos cosméticos y con el préstamo comprará más productos cosméticos para crecer su inventario y aumentar sus ganancias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Residenciales El Campo 2” (Residential Area 2) consists of three members: Reina Isabel P. P., Elbia O., and Santos Blacina P.. They live in Juticalpa, Olancho.

Sra. Reina Isabel P. P. is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children. She started a mini-grocery 12 years ago with a loan of 2000 HNL and it later grew into a mini-supermarket. In 2003, her husband became ill and she had to sell the business in order to pay for his medical expenses. Now she sells secondhand clothing as a traveling merchant. Reina has a good customer base and her children help with selling clothes. With a loan of 5000 HNL, she will buy a bundle of high-quality secondhand clothing. She will also use her savings to buy three additional bundles. This loan will enable her grow her business and increase her earnings so that she can support her family and get ahead. Her dreams include building her own home and seeing her children continue their studies.

Elbia O. sells vegetables and will use her loan to buy vegetables in bulk so that she can increase her earnings.

Santos Blacina P. sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more beauty products to expand her inventory and increase her earnings to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bundle of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso,  es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto, hogareño y respetuoso que tiene 27 años, que está casado con su amada esposa Esmeralda de 24 años, con quien tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 meses de nacido, a quien le pusieron de nombre Wilder. Al recolectar los productos que cultiva, como café, plátano y piña, siente que su trabajo es recompensado y que cada sacrificio vale la pena, por eso tiene 15 años dedicado a la agricultura, además su trabajo es menos pesado porque labora junto a su esposa, pero en temporada de  cosecha y limpieza de sus campos contrata operarios, a quienes por día les paga 20 soles.
Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, es retirar la maleza de sus cultivos, colocar trampas para evitar que los roedores e insectos afecten y dañen sus plantaciones. Este generoso muchacho, ama a su familia, y quiere que en cada acción  que realiza estén juntos, por eso para su futuro, piensa incrementar su producción de bananas y café, productos que tiene gran demanda en los mercados y son muy bien remunerados. En adelante planea instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa, para que lo administre su esposa y así deje de trabajar en la chacra con él y pueda cuidar bien a su hijo. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y asegura estar contento de seguir trabajando en su grupo comunal, con personas que son responsables y emprendedores como él, además dice que en cada decisión que toma tiene el respaldo de su esposa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, también contratará operarios para que limpien sus tierras.
texts.en:
27-year old Alfonso is a hardworking, honest, home-loving, and respectful man. He is married to his beloved wife, 24-year old Esmeralda, and they have a 5-month old son called Wilder. Alfonso believes that his job growing coffee, bananas, and pineapples is well-rewarded and that any sacrifice he makes is worthwhile. For these reasons he has worked as a farmer for 15 years. Something else that makes the job less hard is the fact that his wife works alongside him. However, at harvest time and when the fields need weeding, he hires workers to help and pays them 20 soles per day. Alfonso most enjoys keeping his fields healthy and setting traps for rodents and insects so they don’t harm his crops. This generous family man who loves to have his family by his side wants to increase production of bananas and coffee. As there is a great demand for them in the markets, he gets good money for his produce. In the future he plans to start a home-based business selling groceries so that his wife can look after it and stop working in the fields. This way she will be better able to take care of their son. This is Alfonso’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP and he says he is very happy to continue working with his community group as they are responsible and enterprising people like him. He also says that every decision he makes is supported by his wife. With the loan he will buy several bags of fertilizer to spread on his fields. He will also hire some workers to weed them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire workers

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Franz Radica en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales tres están con el y los demás ya se casaron y se independizaron, vive en el barrio Miraflores de dicha localidad en casa en alquiler, su ocupación es herrero, es decir construcción de canaletas para casa, verjas, ventanas, esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso, el destino del crédito es para compra materiales como Hierro, clavos, soldador y así poder cubrir sus pedidos, su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar; es cliente nuevo en la institución y en el sistema financiero y esta muy contento por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mr. Franz Radica, in El Torno, 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, has seven childred, three of whom still live with him. The other four are married and on their own. He lives in a rented house in the Miraflores neighborhood. [Franz] is a blacksmith; specifically he makes gutters for homes, railings, and windows. This is his only source of income. He will use the money from this loan to buy materials, such as iron, nails, and welding supplies, in order to be able to fulfill his orders. His wife is a homemaker. He is new to our institution and to this system of finance, and he is very grateful for the opportunity given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old, widowed and has 7 school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store,  selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Artidoro

texts.es:
Artidoro tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y cuenta con un hijo dependiente, reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace cuatro años. El cría aves de corral en un ambiente acondicionado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes y a sus vecinos. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos estables y permanentes con los cuales solventa la economía de su familia, por este motivo el siempre se esfuerza por mantenerse en el negocio.

Artidoro desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas aves de corral, así como alimento balanceado para que se desarrollen correctamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.

Artidoro es un padre bastante responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de su familia. El espera seguir trabajando para realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, ya que está construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Artidoro, 37, is married and has a dependent son. He lives with his family in a marginal urban section of Lambayeque, an area with regular commercial activity, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised small farm animals for the last 4 years. He raises barnyard fowl in his back yard in an area set aside for this. When they reach an adequate developmental level he sells them to merchants and neighbors. This activity produces steady and permanent income with which he meets his family’s expenses. For this reason, he always makes an effort to maintain the business. Artidoro would like to buy more fowl as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop correctly. He has therefore deemed it convenient to request his first, 1500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach his objective. Artidoro is quite a responsible father who is always watchful of his family’s wellbeing and development. He hopes to continue working in order to make some improvements on his home’s infrastructure since it is currently built out of rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Edo

texts.fr: A. est un homme de 49 ans qui est marié et père de 2 enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'avepozo qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille il s'est lancée dans le commerce d'habits. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes et il s'approvisionne aux grand marché de Lomé. il veut dynamiser son stock pour acheter de nouvelles gammes de vêtements. il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 2 balles d'habits.
texts.en:
A., a 49 year-old married man with two children, lives with his family in the Avepozo neighborhood, a suburb of Lomé. To support his family he starting a clothing business. His clientele is composed of all types of people and serves clients in the large market in Lomé. He wants to boost his stock and buy new clothing lines. He asks for a loan through WAGES to buy two bales of clothing.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Luz M. A. tiene 27 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Tate.
La Sra. Maria trabaja en el centro comercial Plaza Vea como ayudante de cocina. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañileria. La Sra. Maria requiere el crédito para terminar algunos acabados en su vivienda y poder formar su propio negocio de cocina en su vivienda. La Sra. Ana está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Maria is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Tate. She works in the Plaza Vea commercial center as a kitchen helper. Her husband works as a masonry assistant. She is requesting the loan to finish some projects on her home so she can open her own cooking business out of it. Maria is very thankful for the support you are providing her with through this loan.

loans.use: Make improvements on her home

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with ten children, three of whom attend school while the others have graduated. She lives int her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a vegetable stall selling green vegetables and tomatoes. In addition she has houses for rent which contribute as her other source of income. Halima faces the major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. She hopes to build three more houses for rent in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase iron sheets to renovate her leaking roof and a sack of sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to renovate her leaking roof and a sack of sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Damienne

texts.fr: D. Damienne est née le 17 Janvier 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Damienne est mariée à ASSOGBA Joseph, un  militaire de profession. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Damienne vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou depuis trois ans et plus précisément à Sègbèya l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, où elle mène son activité de vente de tissus, de bijoux et de chaussures de façon secondaire. Damienne exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et fait son approvisionnement à Dantokpa le marché international du Bénin. Damienne vend ses articles par le système de distribution.
