He earns about $3.2 a day while his wife makes $55 a month. He needs a large amount of funds to be able to increase his profit. The loan will be used to increase his capacity to buy more junk to be resold for recycling.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setiap hari Nurasat membawa rombong untuk tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang dibelinya. Dia melakukannya dari pukul 7 pagi – 12 siang. Dia tinggal di Jl. Wibisana Barat bersama isterinya - komplek pemulung - dengan atap dan temboknya dari seng, sedangkan lantainya dari tanah. Dia tidak mengeluarkan biaya untuk tempat tinggalnya. Dia memiliki tiga orang anak, ketiganya tinggal di Jawa. Selama ini ia membiayai sekolah anak-anaknya melalui usaha ini. Per bulan dia memerlukan Rp 400.000,00 untuk biaya pendidikan anak- anaknya dan Rp 20.000,00/hari untuk biaya hidup isteri dan dirinya. Keuntungan dari usaha ini Rp 30.000,00/hari. Penghasilan isteri Rp 500.000,00/bulan. Dia memerlukan modal yang besar untuk meningkatkan keuntungan per harinya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan sangat membantunya untuk menambah jumlah barang-barang rongsokan yang bisa dia beli.

loans.use: Purchase junk materials

loans.name: Sadbarghon

texts.en:
Sadbarghon T. has been selling small household goods for over 3 years, in the J.Rasulov district of Khujand,Tajikistan. She loves her business very much, because it is interesting to help customers choose small items. She has a large assortment of goods and every day her stall is crowded.

Sadbarghon T. is an active client of Microinvest. For the coming holiday month, she wishes to purchase many fancy goods so she can take advantage of the holiday trade and increase her sales and profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods so she can increase sales.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to increase sales

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C., 47, works with her husband as brokers buying fish from the fish farmers and reselling them to other vendors at a market. Together they can earn around US$ 5 each day in profit.

Mrs. Sok C. has three children. One of them is married, another one is enrolled in school, and the third is employed as a taxi driver, earning about US$ 5 each day.

She and her husband have humbly applied for a loan to purchase a simple little truck to use for their business’s transportation. ( Her son is pictured with his taxi-car because Mrs. Sok C. was unavailable when we took the photo.)

loans.use: To purchase a little truck to use for transporting her fish

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia N. is a young 25 year old woman who still lives at home with her parents and seven siblings in a house in the San Miguel neighborhood of Caaguazú. She has only had formal schooling till fifth grade, and for health reasons had to leave. She unfortunately has a sight problem.

For this reason, her father, a farmer, sold some of their animals in order to begin a business of a general store for his daughter. She has been a great business woman and hasn’t let her visual impairment get in the way of the sales. Her dedicated customers say that they buy goods from her because she is personable and has a great variety of products to offer.

She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, rice, powdered drinks, cans of oil and peaches, powdered soap, cigarettes and refreshments for her general store. With an increase in stock she will be able to service more customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, rice, powdered drinks, cans of oil, cigarettes, canned peaches, an assortment of yerba, powdered soap, and refreshments for his general store.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.en:
M. Mukim is 37 years old. He is married with three children of school age.

Mukim is a market vendor. He sells mens clothing. His trading place is located in the local market. Mukim has been in business for ten years already. Being very friendly, Mukim has obtained a reliable base of clientele. Now he requests $1,000.00 US dollars for the term of 5 months. He is planning to purchase new mens clothing. Mukim has been a client of IMON for several years and had proved himself as a reliable client.  He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase new mens clothing to increase inventory

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
N. Mahbuba is 44 years old. She is raising three children alone. Seven years ago, after she had lost her husband, Mahbuba found herself in a situation where she had to support her large family by herself. She tried to find a job, but was not successful. Then she decided to sell old clothing of her neighbors. She barely made both ends meet. 
At this point Mahbuba decided to take her fist loan from the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON. The loan provided by IMON helped Mahbuba find her source of stable income. She is selling socks in the local market. 
Working hard, she managed to make her business profitable and generae sufficient income to support her family. Today, Mahbuba is planning to increase the working capital with the purpose of further development of the business. With this purpose, she requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. She proved reliable with her last loan from IMLF IMON. And now Mahbuba thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To increase her working capital, to develop the business and increase the level of income.

loans.name: Elvis Hamilton

texts.es:
The cattle husbandry business requires great effort and sacrifice. Mr. Elvis Valeiro R. has been devoted to this activity since his young age and has his own cattle. He feeds his oxen and calves to ensure their development and growth, such that, when the time is right, he can commercialize the derived products, such as milk.

He presently needs to acquire animals for breeding. For this purpose, he turns to Ceprodel, in order to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase the animals. The profits form this activity benefit him, his wife and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la ganadería es una labor que requiere mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El señor Elvis Valeiro R. se dedica a esta labor desde muy joven, teniendo su propio ganado. El alimenta diariamente a sus bueyes y terneros para su desarrollo y crecimiento y de esta manera cuando se da el momento, se aprovechan sus productos derivados como la leche, para su comercialización.

Actualmente la necesidad que este caballero debe de suplir es la compra de ganado para la crianza. Por esta razón acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los animales para proceder con su crianza y comercialización. Por medio de esta labor se beneficia tanto él, su esposa y tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new collection of shoes and beauty products for her business

loans.name: Nelsa Leticia's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Nelsa P., soy comerciante y tengo 3 años de estar en esta actividad, tengo 3 hijas de las cuales dos ya estan graduadas del colegio y solo una depende de mi, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta mi producto por el precio y la calidad por su puesto, en estos momentos tan dificiles es necesario vender productos a precios bajos para que los clientes los puedan comprar, cuando termino de vender en las mañanas y parte de la tarde mi producto me dirijo a una cafeteria en la cual trabajo haciendo comida. necesito un prestamo para poder comprar mas mercaderia y tener mayores ganancias y con las ganancias poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: compra de pantalones de caballero y dama, ropa de niño, blusas y camisas.

loans.name: Shamigul .

texts.ru:
Shamigul A. lives in the city of Yavan. She works at the marketplace "Tichorat". She trades womens clothing there. She has been engaged in this type of business for 7 years. For the school fair, Shamigul plans to receive a loan and purchase school supplies. This will help her earn money during the season, so that she can use the income to help her family. She is the sole provider for her four children, because her husband does not work and it is essential for her to develop her business. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Алиева Шамигуль проживает в городе Яван. Работает на рынке «Тичорат». Торгует женской одеждой.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже семь лет. К школьной ярмарке Шамигуль планирует получить кредит и привезти школьный товар. Это поможет заработать в сезон . Прибыль использует для семьи . Ведь она одна обеспечивает четверых детей. Муж нигде не работает и ей нкеобходимо развивать свой бизнес для того . Полгасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Nihada

texts.en: Nihada lives in the town Te anj and she is not married. She asked for a loan in the amount of 1200 KM in order to buy a sewing machine. She works in a leather factory as a seamstress, and she wants to use her knowledge. She will buy a sewing machine and do tailoring at home. In that way, she can earn additional money and help support her parents and their household.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ni Nengah Karsini

texts.id: Setiap orang pasti memiliki keinginan untuk mengubah standar kehidupannya menjadi lebih baik. Hal ini terjadi juga dalam kehidupan Ni Nengah Karsini, ibu dengan seorang anak yang saat ini berusia 10 tahun dan masih mengenyam pendidikan di Sekolah Dasar. Keinginan tersebut muncul setelah melihat keberhasilan tetangganya menjadi peternak babi setelah mendapat binaan dan bantuan dana dari Dinari dan Kiva. Walaupun tingkat pendidikan yang dimilikinya masih sangat rendah, namun semangat dan keinginannya untuk meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya sangat besar. Ni Nengah Karsini memutuskan untuk bergabung dengan program Yayasan Dinari,  khususnya program Ternak Babi yang periode pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pinjaman pada akhir periode. Hal tersebut berdasarkan perhitungan masa pemeliharaan babi selama 4 – 5 bulan dan bulan ke 6, peternak sudah siap menjual babinya. Pinjaman yang didapatnya dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi dan pakan. Ni Nengah Karsini berencana untuk menjual anak babi yang dipelihara selama 2 bulan. Induk babi yang sekarang sudah mempunyai 5 ekor anak dan 2 bulan ke depan bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 300.000.- per ekor. Induk babi yang akan dibelinya akan dipersiapkan untuk masa panen berikutnya. Ni Nengah Karsini sangat bersyukur ia dapat bergabung dalam program ini dan ia pun bangga karena dapat memberi sumbangan untuk kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Karsi is a mother of a 10 old kid. She is inspired by her neighbor's success in pig farming business. She wants to follow her neighbor's footstep so she can also improve her family's welfare.

She joined the DINARI Foundation program where she is raising piglets for a 6 month period. Her breeding pig is now having 5 piglets that she can sell for IDR 300 thousand (around USD 32)/ pig in 2 months time.

She really hopes to be able to improve her economic condition by joining this program.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy breeding pig (Membeli induk)

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.en:
Gloria Amanda R. C. is a single mom of two children, aged 13 and 9. Gloria is a member of the community bank, Juanito. She supports her family by selling cheese and potatoes. Every Saturday and Sunday, Gloria travels to the local markets to sell her goods. Monday through Friday, Gloria travels to Lima to package food to export to Spain.

She will use her loan of 2000 soles ($675 USD) to purchase bus tickets for her weekly trips to Lima, and also to purchase cheese and potatoes. Currently, Gloria is saving in hopes of purchasing her own land to build her own house and to purchase a car to travel back and forth to Lima.

loans.use: To buy bus tickets, cheese, and potatoes

loans.name: Mohammad Hamayoun

texts.en:
Mohammad Hamayoun, who has a contracting company, is married with 2 children. He is a educated man and a very hard worker. He has a building that is located in a good area near the street but he tried many times to build shops and rent them out but he could not. When he found AFSG and asked about this loan process he was really very happy.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 30000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to start building the shops and get them ready to rent in order to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support with his family to provide a better future.

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for a success loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: To start building shops

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a woman who treasures her family more than anything else.  She is happily married to Dominador, the man of her dreams, and they have five children: Sharmaine – 25 years old, Dominador – 24 years old, Danilo – 22 years old, Imee Marie – 21 years old and Jerwin – 15 years old.  All of them did not finish their studies since they could not afford to send them to school.  They live in Antagan 1st, wherein farming is the main source of livelihood of the people.  

Luzviminda works as a farmer.  Due to financial difficulties in buying the needed farm inputs, she would like to ask for financial assistance.  The amount of PHP12,000 will enable her to acquire the necessary inputs for her farm.  She does not want to borrow from traders because aside from asking for collaterals or security, interest is also higher which sometimes they could not afford since they are only work as farm tenants.  

She is hopeful that her request will be granted and she is already thankful that they were given this kind of opportunity and a chance to prove that they can make it.  “Someday, I hope to experience a better life than what we have right now”, added Luzviminda.  

She prays that God will bless them with good health for them to pursue their farming activity .

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Lomé, Mme Enyonam A. est marié et a deux (02) enfants. Elle coiffeuse de formation et a ouvert un atelier de coiffure à Lomé dans le quartier de Kégué. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avec beaucoup de dévouement lui permet tant bien que mal de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Aujourd’hui sa clientèle s’accroît et elle est confrontée à un manque crucial de matériels de travail. Aussi sollicite-t-elle un financement pour acheter des séchoirs électriques, des mèches et d’autres produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, at Lomé, Mrs. Enyonam A. is married with two children. She is a trained hair dresser and has opened a hair dressing shop in the Lomé suburb of Kégué. She is very dedicated to this business, which more or less provides for her needs and those of her family. Now, her clientele has increased and she is faced with a shortage of working materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase electric hair dryers, hair extensions and other cosmetic products.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electric hair dryers, hair extensions and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sengheun

texts.en: Mrs. Sengheun S. is a 36-year-old widow and she now lives in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a cassava middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more cassava to resell and hire laborers to help her. She hopes to increase her income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cassava to resell and hire laborers to help her.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has her own small shop and has been a juice and bites seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She belongs to the Jitahidi group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $195. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more breads for her business. She is hoping her profit will increase through this loan, and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.

Maryam is 46 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 9 and 6. She also cares for four additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Alesi, Hadija, and Veis. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more items (cooking oil and flour) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh, 51, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Saleh has owned a faux bijoux shop for two years and is now requesting a loan of $1300 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.
	
His relationship with his clients, who are friends, neighbours and community members, and his regular diversification of merchandise make Saleh speciA. in his work. Having built up his customer base from very modest beginnings, in the future he plans to expand his shop by selling beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyết Lê Thị was born in 1984. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a hairdresser and her daily income is $6. She is a hardworking woman and is the leader of the group. She wants to borrow $310 to expand her business.

There are 6 other Fund participants in her group:

Nguyệt T. Thị Trần was born in 1975. She needs $310 to invest her motor repair shop.

Tùy Đỗ Phương was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $230) to buy fruit to sell in the market.

Tùng Lê Đăng was born in 1970. He wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (approximately $260) to buy chickens to sell in the market.

Hạnh Lê Thị Hồng was born in 1973. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (approximately $330) to buy pigs to sell in the market.

Hoa Quỳnh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1972. She wants to borrow 1,962,000 VND (approximately $110) to run a small business.

Lý Lê Thị was born in 1976. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $280) to buy fish to raise.

loans.use: To exand her hairdressing business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en casa alquilada en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 67 años de edad y desde muy joven trabaja vendiendo carne en el mercado, actividad que sigue manteniendo en la actualidad ya que es su único medio de subsistencia. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más carne y mantener su negocio estable.

Su antecedente histórico la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina lives in a rented home on Buenos Aires Ave. in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. She's 67, and since she was very young she's been selling meat in the market, an activity she still does since its her only means of subsistence. The loan she's requesting is the increaser her capital, purchase more meat, and keep her business stable. Her background qualifies her as a good client and can access a new loan. She's been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Babacar WIllane est vendeur de paille d’arachides l aliment principal des ovins ; des caprins et autre ruminants. Il a quitté son village natal pour s’installer à Mbour ville côtière située à 70km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise.les revenus tiré du commerce lui permettent d’entretenir sa femme et ses enfants restés au village avec ses parents. Il a eu à bénéficier d’un premier prêt destiné à l’achat une charrette pour le transport hippomobile. Avec le prêt qu’il solliciter il va acheter de la paille d’arachide.
texts.en:
Babacar WIllane sells peanut straw, a principal food for sheep, goats, and other ruminants. He left his native village to come and live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar, the Senegalese capital. The income from his business allows him to support his wife and children who stayed back in the village with his parents. He received a first loan to buy a wagon for horse-drawn transport. With the loan that he is now requesting, he is going to buy peanut straw.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Orfita

texts.es:
ORFITA D. JESUS V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”  en el Distrito D. Calleria, tiene 42 años, 2 hijos, y su esposo es chofer.

Ella vendía juanes en su barrio, el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra D. algunos huevos por docenas, arroz, pollos, etc. para preparar los juanes y luego venderlos a sus vecinos. Ahora tiene un pequeño puesto en la vereda D. su casa en donD. venD. huevos, pollo, menestras, etc.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 ampliara el negocio comprando una mesa mas y con lo que queda comprara mas víveres para surtir su negocio.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da al contribuir con las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Orfita D. J. V. belongs to the Mujeres Solidarias Community Bank. She lives in the Calleria district. She is 42, has 2 children, and her husband is a driver. She sells “juanes” (a traditional dish in the Peruvian rainforest). She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy dozens of eggs, rice, chicken, etc. to prepare the juanes to then sell to her neighbors. She now has a small stand on the pavement outsiD. of her house where she sells eggs, chicken, vegetable stew, etc. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will expand her business and buy one more table. With what is left, she will buy supplies to stock her business. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community by contributing to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various food and a table to expand her business

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old man who lives with his wife and their two children in Saida, Southern Lebanon.

Imad has owned a barber shop since 2003. He requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to change his salon’s décor and to purchase new tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Imad is special in his work because he does it well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on his business because of his experience, since he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business and purchasing the salon.

loans.use: To change his salon’s décor and purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora C. is from the village of Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old and married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Dioscora operates a family business venture in the retail sector where she operates a general store. Dioscora's main source of income for the business comes from selling products in the local community. Dioscora has been engaged in her business for over two years now and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dioscora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioscora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Dioscora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP of which she plans to use to purchase additional consumer products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dioscora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain family basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional general store products to sell, including sugar, sardines, salt, rice and etc.

loans.name: Масрур

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Масрур парень в возрасте 22 лет, имеет незаконченное высшее образование.Ему помог открыть маленькое кафе его отец. На сегодняшний день у него маленький оборотный капитал в кафетерии. Масрур готовит на завтраки прохожим клиентам яичницу, жареную колбасу, блинчики с мясом , гамбургеры и другие быстро приготавливаемые блюда. Масрур хочет в кредит купить холодильную камеру для хранения быстро портящихся продуктов. На снимке Масрур в день выдачи.

loans.use: услуги кафе

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a very responsible and hard working man. He lives in Nablus city of Palestine with his wife and their child. Raed has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many other items in his store.

In order to continue growing and serving the demand of his customers, Raed needs a loan of $1,500. Having this capital would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Mrs. Chenda S. lives in Cham Bork Tim village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller.  She Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now she is requesting a loan to buy pump machine, rice seed, and to buy some fruits to sell to earn income. Her husband, Mr. Yeam Rith, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Chenda S. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pump machine, rice seed, and to buy some fruits to sell to earn income.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun K., 59, is a widow and resides in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of manufacturing fabric for washing mirrors, earning US $6.6 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed in a hotel in the city, earning US $2.6 per day. She plans to take a loan of US $500 to purchase more fabric to produce more outputs to generate more income to raise a good standard of living of the family.

loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira M. is from the village of Maanas, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is 48 years old and has been planting rice since she had a family. She has nine children, the eldest of whom is 27. Her husband is a farmer, and they work together every day to grow rice to generate a regular income to meet their family's needs. She says that her farm is becoming more productive due to Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). A previous loan from CEVI has helped a great deal in buying all the farming necessities to have an abundant harvest.

Elvira would like to request a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She appreciates CEVI's services because the loans have a very low interest rate (2% a month), which makes them affordable to repay.

loans.use: To finance her farm

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 31 years old and married to Gary, who is an overseas factory worker. They are blessed with two children: Daniel, six years old; and Irene Mae, two years old. Michelle is hoping that she can sustain the needs of her family with the income earned through her store business. Michelle is a store owner within the village of Quezon, San Isidro. They are happily living there. She would like to expand and buy additional merchandise so that she can provide for the needs of her family. In this regard, she is requesting 5,000 PHP as additional capital for buying merchandise for her store. She would be thankful if her loan request were granted. Expanding her business is one of her dreams, so that she can improve her way of living.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pone

texts.en:
Pone R. is currently in the business of selling bread on her veranda and is requesting a loan to buy more items like groundnut paste, cakes, biscuits, etc. to sell. Pone is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a tailor. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more items like groundnut paste, cakes, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita P. is from the city of Catadman Ozamiz. She is 40 years old. Rita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling fish in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be invested in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Aida Camara

texts.fr:
Caissière en stage à IMCEC Bambey, Madame Aïda Camara S. sollicite un financement de 300 000 frs CFA pour relancer une activité secondaire. Elle compte acheter  avec  ce crédit des produits céréaliers (mil, arachide, niébé) qu’elle place sur le marché de Bambey.  
Entré dans le commerce  par passion et pour aider son mari retraité, Madame S. ne veut pas rater l’opportunité d’avoir  des produits hivernaux au bon marché dans la zone. Elle pense gagner beaucoup dans ce commerce afin d’améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille en prenant en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A cashier in training at IMCEC Bambey, Ms. Aïda Camara S. is requesting financing in the amount of 300,000 francs CFA to restart a secondary business.  She plans on using this loan to buy grains (millet, peanuts, black-eye peas) to put on the Bambey market.  In commerce for the love of it and to help her retired husband, Ms. S. doesn't want to miss the chance to obtain off-season goods locally.  She believes she will earn a lot in this business, so as to improve her family's living conditions by meeting the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D., aged 58, is a retired police officer living in Thies, a city about seventy kilometers from the capital, Dakar. He is married and the father of seven children.

After retiring from the force, Mr. D. began his small trade, primarily in used televisions and fabrics from Mauritania. He has received three prior loans from UIMCEC, one of which was funded through Kiva, and reports that he has re-invested most of the proceeds back into his business.

The small loan of 50,000 FCFA will allow him to cover the transport costs to Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania. He already has the necessary savings to purchase the fabrics.

loans.use: To finance a trip to replenish his stock of fabrics

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Aida Esperanza F. es una persona que depende de los envió de remesa de sus hijo que están en Estado Unido de Norte América. Ella se dedica ala elaboración de ropa.
Aida va usar el crédito para pagar la mano de obra de la reparación de su casa ya que la van a repellar y además va a comprar arena.
Ella espera que la remodelación de su vivienda le ayude a estar mas cómoda y le de una mayor presentación a su vivienda .
Aida es madre soltera tiene 3 hijo todos ellos mayores de edad  y no tiene persona a su cargo. Este es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel ella dice que el crédito anterior fue de gran ayuda ya que con ese crédito pudo construir su casa.
texts.en:
Aida Esperanza F.'s main source of income is the money sent to her by her son, who is in the United States. She is a seamstress. Aida will use the funds to pay labor costs to have her house replastered; she will also buy sand. She hopes that the repairs will help her to be more comfortable and that her house will be more attractive. Aida is a single mother of three adult children; she has no one under her care. This is her second loan with Ceprodel. She tells us that the previous loan was of great help to her because it allowed her to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repairs and to buy sand.

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced A. is from the village of Poblacon, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Merced is single and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living, Merced prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals and she also sells soft drinks and some food for snacks. Merced has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merced joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merced successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 PHP from GDMPC. Merced is requesting her fourth loan, for 2000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

Merced plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nelson Jaime

texts.es: Nelson Jaime P. L. de 39 años de edad, posee una panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar diferentes tipos de pan, ya sea dulce o salado. La panadería está en su propia casa de habitación, la cual está ubicada en Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 5 a los 19 años de edad, de los cuales todos estudian. Desde hace 20 años que Nelson posee esta panadería, ganando muchos clientes, y así mismo experiencia para poder mejorar su servicio y de esta forma poder brindar mayor variedad de pan. Nelson posee un negocio muy bien establecido, en el que envían a 6 repartidores de pan a dejarlo a los negocios de cada cliente. Nelson solicita un préstamo a integral, con la buena intención de comprar mayor cantidad de harina, azúcar, miel, y muchos otros ingredientes que son vitales para la realización de este oficio. Para Nelson es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar su negocio ya que su extensa familia lo necesita mucho, esto debido a que es la única manera de ganarse la vida. Así mismo sus hijos se encuentran muy orgullosos de su padre ya que siempre lo han visto trabajar y esforzarse al completo por ellos.
texts.en:
Nelson Jaime P. L. is 39 years old, and he has a bakery. In the bakery he makes different types of bread, be it sweet or salty. The bakery is in his own house, which is located in Santa Tecla in the La Libertad department. He lives with his wife and their five children. They are between 5 and 19 years old, and they go to school. Nelson has had the bakery for 20 years, and he has won many customers. He has the experience to be able to improve his service and offer a greater variety of bread. Nelson’s business is very well established, and there are six bread deliverymen to leave the bread at each customer’s business. Nelson is asking Integral for a loan to buy a larger quantity of flour, sugar, honey, and a lot of other ingredients that are vital to do this job. It is very important to Nelson to be able to improve his business because his extended family needs it a lot. That is because it is his only way of earning a living. His children are very proud of their father because they have always seen him work and put forth all of his effort for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, shortening, and other products to make bread

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marjorie Argentina

texts.es:
Marjorie Gutiérrez de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio ellos tienen 2 hijos de 16 y 11 años.  

Ella empezó como comerciante informal en todas las zonas de Guayaquil pero por la inseguridad que había y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio la conllevo a poner un local en su casa. 

Ahora ella tiene una papelería muy surtida, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, vende útiles escolares, láminas, fomix y ahora ha implementado vender ropa.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, ropa, laminas para surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para llevar los artículos y venderlos por pedido.
texts.en:
Marjorie Gutiérrez is 37, and she lives in an area outlying the city in the Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of concrete, and she only has electricity. Her husband helps her in the business. She has two children, 16 and 11. She started as an informal merchant in all the areas of Guayaquil. However, the lack of safety and the exasperating idea of having her own business led her to set up a place in her house. Now she has a very well stocked stationery store. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She sells schools supplies, paper, and “fomix” (foam crafts). Now she has started selling clothes. With this loan she wants to buy notebooks, clothes, and paper to better stock her business. In the future she wants to buy a car to carry the items and sell them by order.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, clothes, and paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Juntas Venceremos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas Venceremos se encuentra formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que siempre piensan en sus familias primero y trabajan día a día para entregarles una mejor calidad de vida, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe   reconocida por sus escritores, su cultura,   su gente que es muy amable y gastronomía.

La señora  María M. tiene 22 años de edad,  vive  arrendado una casa en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con su esposo y su niña de tres años,  su esposo trabaja como cobrador de los buses interprovinciales mientras que ella iniciará su propio negocio en la venta de productos Herbalife ya cuenta con  su propia clientela porque trabajaba con su primo en la venta de estos productos.

Este  es su primer crédito y llegó ser parte del banco comunal gracias a su hermana, con su crédito comprará vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios de la línea Herbalife.  Su meta es superarse cada día un poco más.

La señora  Fanny N. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una socia muy alegre, se encuentra en su quinto ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal invitada por una compañera del mismo, los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio pues ella  se dedica al arte de la sastrería se graduó a mas de ejercer  es  maestra, cuenta con un  pequeño taller de su propiedad  hace un  año, no tiene un horario fijo de labores y trabaja según la cantidad de pedidos que tenga.

A sus veinte  años  Fanny  vive en unión libre y ya es madre  de una niña de dos años, su esposo migró al exterior en busca un mejor futuro para su familia y le envía dinero para cubrir las necesidades de las dos, aun no tiene  casa propia por lo que vive  en casa de su suegra;  con el dinero de su crédito va a invertir en su taller comprando telas, hilos, tizas, cierres, botones etc...

Su meta es llegar a ser una modista profesional.
texts.en:
The community bank “Juntas Venceremos” (Together We will Conquer) is formed by a group of women that always think about their families first and they work every day to offer them a better quality of life; they live in city of Cuenca, a major city well known for their writers, culture, gastronomy and their people who are very pleasant. Mrs. María M. is 22 years old and lives with her husband and 3-year old daughter in a rented house located in the major city of Cuenca. Her husband works as a fee collector in the inter-province buses; she will start her own business selling Herbalife products; she already has her own customers since she works with her cousin selling these products. This is her first loan; she became a member of the community bank thanks to her sister; whit the loan, she will buy vitamins and nutritional supplements from Herbalife. Her goal is to better herself a little more every day. Mrs. Fanny N. lives in the major city of Cuenca; she is a cheerful member and this is her fifth cycle working with her community bank; she was invited by another member of the community bank. The loans have benefited her business; she works in the art of tailoring for which she graduated; she is also a teacher and has a small workshop which she has owned for a year now. She does not have a fixed work schedule and she works as required by the orders she has. Fanny is 20 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of a 2-year old daughter. Her husband emigrated in search of a better future for the family and he sends money to support them both; she does not have her own house so she leaves with her mother-in-law. With the money from the loan, she will invest in her workshop buying fabrics, threads, chalk, zippers, buttons, etc. Her goal is to become a professional fashion designer.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vitamins and nutrional supplements form Herbalife; buy fabrics, threads, zippers, chalk, buttons.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is proud of her groceries business. With this business she has been able to support her family. She is married to a carpenter and they are blessed with 6 children. Her children are in secondary and primary school. She lives in Benin city , Edo State, 

Recently, Esther has been experiencing increase in the number of customers that patronize her stall especially those purchasing drinks; she needs a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase a deep freezer for cooling her drinks and groceries. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and a deep freezer

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena ha trabajado mucho tiempo con Fundación y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ambos están estudiando con el sacrificio que ella realiza. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ha obtenido mucha experiencia, pues ha sido necesario para el sustento del hogar, ella tiene que estar actualizando sus revistas de confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Con el financiamiento necesita comprar más productos al por mayor pues así podrá tener más material para sus vestidos, trajes, pantalones entre otras cosas  ella tiene muchos sueños pero le gustaría terminar de realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena has worked with the Foundation for a long time and has made full payments on time. She has two children, both of whom are studying thanks to her sacrifices. For more than eight years she has worked as a seamstress. She has a lot of experience because she has had to work to support her household. She always needs to have current magazines so that she can use them as guides for sewing different outfits. With this loan she will purchase fabric and other materials wholesale to make dresses, suits, pants, and other articles of clothing. She has many hopes for the future, but she would like to finish making improvements to her home first.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and materials for seamstress/tailor business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R., 59, is from the town of Fugu Jones. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald R. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Donald has worked in a transportation business — primarily motor transport like "habal-habal" services — for over a year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Donald joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Donald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Donald from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Get more land under cultivation and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres, para poder solventar sus gastos.

 Ella tiene la tienda de viveres para ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó comprando arroz, verduras y lácteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y carnes para su tienda, en el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in Perimetral de Guayaquil, a suburban area bordered by a salt-water stream. She has a grocery store in order to cover family expenses. She started out purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products, and since that time she has continued working to ease her into old age because her children are now adults. She works from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. With the loan she plans to purchase rice, oil and meats for her store. In the future she wants to better stock her store and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oils and meats

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul M. is the leader of the group. She is 29 and married. She has three daughters, all of them are preschool age (under 7).  

Nurgul works as a teacher and her husband is a constructor. In order to make money, Nurgul and her husband breed livestock. They have been doing it for five years. Sometimes they sell some animals to cover family expenses. With money received from the loan, Nurgul wants to improve her living conditions and purchase a fridge. In the future, she plans to increase the number of livestock they have and start repairing her house.

Kokon J., 48, is a widow. She has raised six children; the younger son and the younger daughter are at school and the others are working, married and live separately with their families. Kokon applied for the loan because she needs money to celebrate her son’s wedding. 

Burmakan K. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 54 and a widow. She has raised eight children, most of them live separately, except the youngest daughter, who is at school. Four years ago, Burmakan sold three sheep and with that money, she started to sell convenience goods. In this way, she earns 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock and with the rest of the money, she will purchase a variety of goods to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she plans to start repairing her house.

Imarathan D., 55, is a widow. She has raised five children, four of them are at school. Eight years ago, with the initial investment of 26000 soms, Imarathan started to sell convenience goods. She makes 10000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of goods to increase the turnover of her business. 

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 \

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Soline Ablanvi

texts.fr: A. Soline Ablanvi est née en 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Soline est mariée à NOUKPO Antonin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Soline vit avec sa famille au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Soline a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture. A côté de cette activité, Soline vend des produits de mercerie et divers autres produits (papier hygiénique, savons, dentifrices, etc.) à son domicile. Soline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Soline exerce cette activité depuis onze ans et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Soline sollicite à nouveau un prêt afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Soline Ablanvi A. was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, in 1964. Soline is married to Antonin Noukpo and is the mother of 3 educated children. Soline and her family have lived in the Ayélawadjè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about ten years. The couple manages the needs of the household together. Soline left school in the secondary level and then learned to sew. In addition to working as a seamstress, Soline sells assorted notions and other products (toilet paper, soaps, toothpastes, etc.) from her home. Soline buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Soline has been in this business for eleven years and has already had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid on time. Soline is seeking a new loan to build her business and to better meet her clients' needs.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and assorted other products (toilet paper, salad dressing, rice, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame S. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. Maame operates a provisions store and sells wakye at Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Maame uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Maame will use the loan to purchase more beans and rice to prepare wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and rice to prepare wakye to sell

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

Para la señora María este es su segundo ciclo con el Banco Comunal y esta muy a gusto y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que reciben para impulsar su negocio. Tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual procreo dos hijos, una ya es mayor de edad que ya está casada, el menor de sus hijos vive con ella,  su marido es mecánico. Ella estudia diseño de modas en el Instituto Tecnológico De Diseño (SMOD).

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, elabora toda clase de vestidos desde trajes de novias, quinceañeras hasta trajes casuales aunque siempre dice que a ella le gusta inventar los diseños, trabaja todas las tardes hasta la noche ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a estudiar, dice que cuando tiene mucho trabajo necesita de ayudantes para terminar a tiempo.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar telas y otros artículos para la confeccion de ropa, su meta es llegar a ser una gran diseñadora de modas.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank Su Bankito meets in the neighborhood of La California in the city of Portoviejo, known as la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos. 

This is María's second loan with the communal bank and she's very grateful to the Fundación Espoir for the help they've given her in building her business. She's 44-years-old and she lives in a common law marriage with the father of her two children. Her daughter is grown and married, her son lives with her, and her husband is a mechanic. She studied fashion design at the Instituto Tecnológico de Diseño (SMOD).

She has a sewing shop in her house where she makes all types of clothing from wedding and quinceañera gowns to casual wear. She always says that she likes to create her own designs. She works every afternoon until dark because in the mornings she has to go to school. She says that when she has lots of work she needs assistants to finish on time. 

This loan will be used to buy fabric and other items for making clothes. Her goal is to become a famous fashion designer.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr:
monsieur de 48 ans, celibataire et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente et est tres gentil envers ses clients..  En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours

Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires,des robinets,des ampoules.
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise en Afrique de l'ouest. 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
Louis is 48 years old, single and the father of three children between the ages of 5 and 21 years old. He started his hardware business in 2002 in order to take care of the needs of his family.

He has many sales strategies and is very nice to his customers. On average, he sells between 5,000 and 50,000 francs of goods each day. With this loan, he will increase his stock by buying switches, fuses, toilets, faucets, and light bulbs. In the future, he hopes to enter the wholesale business and with his savings he will open a large store; he will travel to West Africa to purchase his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase toilets, faucets and light bulbs.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband, mother and children in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Ana describes her as a strong, hard-working woman with a healthy appetite for learning and big plans for the future. 

Ana runs two businesses. Over the past 4 years, she has gained experience selling various items such as jewellery, clothing, cosmetics and shoes from her home, where she has opened a bazaar (seen in the picture). Her customers arrive daily to peruse the various products she has available for sale. This business arrangement allows Ana to take care of domestic responsibilities when business is slow, including taking care of her mother and children. 

Her other business is selling catalog items such as cooking utensils, appliances and clothing. For this activity, Ana travels from door to door in her community, offering catalog products to customers. She has been running her business in this way over the past four years, and she has one employee.  In a good month Ana earns 700,000 colones, in a bad month, only 300,000. 

Ana has a large space in her home to display a varied range of products. She says competition is basically nonexistent in the area in which she lives. The majority of her clients are workers at a nearby plastic manufacturing plant; others are family members and acquaintances in the community.  Sometimes, her children help her with her business so that Ana can take care of her mother.

 Ana plans to use this loan to invest in both of her productive activities. She hopes to invest in the purchase of various merchandise items such as clothing, jewellery, cosmetics and cooking utensils. 

In general, Ana wakes up early in order to carry out her domestic responsibilities such as preparing breakfast, cleaning the house and assisting her mother.  When she is not doing housework, she is dedicated to making sales, whether in the bazaar or on the street. Ana´s goal is to expand her business and provide a prosperous lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise (clothing, jewellery, cosmetics)

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
el sr. Henry S. cuenta con una pulpería y tambien da el servicio de moler maíz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “ANY”.
Don Henry esta casado y junto a su compañera de hogar han procreado 4 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos y les brindan los gastos de alimentación, educación, salud y vivienda.
Henry se levanta todos los dias bien temprano para atender sus clientes que vienen a moler maiz para fabricar las tortillas, luego de dar este servicio inicia las operaciones con su pulperia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry S. has small convenience store and also provides service to grind corn; his business is located at the house where he lives and it operates under the name of Any’s Store. Mr. Henry is married and together with his wife have 4 children who are dependants; Henry and his wife provide for the expenses of food, education, health and housing.
Henry gets up very early every day to help his customers that come to grind corn to make tortillas; after providing this service, he begins operating his store. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise and stock up for his business.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beans, corn flour, meats, dairy products, cured meats, eggs, lard, margarine, soups, bread, cookies, pasta, salsas, salt, condiments.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 53 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de taller de motos el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa y lleva por nombre El Chacalon , el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo este el medio por el cual sacan a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio asi como repuestos para motos , acite entre otros. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group member is part of the LLANKACHINAPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and the department of Cusco. 

Juan is the group member. He is 53 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. He owns a vehicle repair business in which the workshop is located in his house. The business is called El Chacalon. He works together with his wife, and by these means they support their family. 

He is asking for a loan to build his business to sell replacement vehicle parts and oil, among other things. 

He thanks those who allow for the realization of his dreams through this loan, and promises to repay the loan in installment payments in the established increments.

loans.use: He is asking for a loan to build his business to sell replacement vehicle parts and oil, among other things.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of them in school. David has had a business making bricks for six years.         

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more materials. With the help of this loan, David hopes to generate greater profits to buy food. In the future, he hopes to own another business.

loans.use: more brick-building materials

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en:
Lhagva D. is 47 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house on their fenced property. Her oldest daughter attends university and her youngest daughter attends a local high school. Her middle son works and lives as a herder in the countryside raising livestock.  Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Lhagva operates a dairy retail business in her town. She began the business in 1998 with a working capital of 50,000 MNT. After many years of successful operation, her working capital now exceeds 1,400,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to expand her business by operating multiple businesses with her husband. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products for resale

loans.name: Arin

texts.en:
Arin is a 27-year-old mother of two. She lives in northern Israel and runs a small daycare center in the village where she lives. Arin was trained and worked as a teacher's aide in special education but she wanted to take her love of children and education and apply it to small children. Arin decided to open up her daycare center and worked with the municipality to meet standards and gain approval to be a municipal day care. The children and payment come from the municipality so she has a promised income each month. Arin has gained an excellent reputation in her village among the parents who appreciate her care and respect of their children. Arin has also taken steps to develop a relationship between the parents so the children become a strong group during the time they are under her care.

Arin needed this loan for supplies and to order stock and prepare her daycare. With this loan, she is assured her daycare has access to the needed supplies.

In the future Arin wants to expand her daycare, hire staff and take on the care of more children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her daycare.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Ниёзова Лутфия проживает в районе Варзоб. Ей 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Четыре года как занимается животноводством. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: N. Lutfiya lives in the Varzob region. She's forty-five years old, married and has five children. She doesn't have a university education. For the past four years she has bred animals for sale. N. is asking for a loan in order to buy some cattle.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Wailasa Women's Group A-Jinja

texts.en:
28-year-old I. Eric has been in the liquor sales business for the past 10 years in Wandago-Jinja. Weekly this business generates shillings 100,000. Eric who is happily married with three kids says he inherited this business from his late father. 

Eric is requesting this loan to buy more drums for distilling more quantities of crude liquor. Eric belongs to Wailasa Women's group-Jinja. He says in this way he will be able to make more sales and thus more profit.

loans.use: The purchase of drums for distilling more quantities of crude liquor

loans.name: Mary Claire

texts.en:
Mary Claire S. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Mary Claire is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Claire owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling bamboo made furniture like sofas to local businesses and community members. Mary Claire has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Claire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Claire has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Mary Claire is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Claire from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama N. is a peddler of kenkey (type of sourdough dumpling) at Takoradi. She serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce.  Ama has attained a senior high level of education.  She is a single parent taking care of 3 children. As a single mother, things have not been easy, but she sees to the well-being of her children. A loan will enable her to produce food in larger quantities in order to generate greater income.  She will be able to properly take care of her children. Her business plans are to establish a kenkey restaurant and to provide the best of education for her children.

loans.use: to produce in larger quantity to generate greater income

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 children. She and her husband are both farmers. While her husband mainly manages their rice farm, she also makes sure to help keep it productive. She also takes good care of their children. Lilibeth always wishes for her family to have good health.

Lilibeth's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and a member of glory group in Faulu Kenya. She sells clothes to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for eight years. She runs her business with one employee.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has experienced a lot of growth in her business hence improving her living standards. She hopes to expand her business and open another outlet. She wants a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit B. lives in Yerevan with his wife and children. He is engaged in the jewelry trade.  Davit’s family lives in his wife’s parents’ apartment. His wife’s parents themselves have moved abroad to find work there. Davit gets his main income from sales, but his financial means are not enough to meet the family needs and support his own household. So Davit wants to increase and develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to expand the jewelry inventory variety and increase sales.

loans.use: to pay for jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an electric embroidery machine

loans.name: Hulda Azucena

texts.es:
La Sra. Hulda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 01 hijo y cursa la primaria.

Motivada por sus padres  se inicia en el negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa de cama.  Al sufrir un accidente de  tránsito, decide cambiar de actividad por la venta de cosméticos iniciándose con un capital de S / 400.00 nuevos soles.  Este negocio le da la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos y como mujer sentirse realizada.  

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales y esmaltes de uñas, para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Hulda se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Señora Hulda belongs to the communal bank "El Abiseo" [the name of a river] in the district of Juanjuí, department of San Martín. She is single and the mother of one son, who attends elementary school.

Her parents encouraged her to open a store selling shoes and bed linen. After having suffered a road accident she decided to change her activity to the sale of cosmetics with a start capital of 400 nuevos soles. This business gives her the opportunity to earn her own money and to be fulfilled in her life as a woman.

She will use this loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy beauty products for her inventory, such as perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, creams, face powder, talcum powder for adults and babies, lipsticks and nail polish in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Hulda is very happy and wants to continue working to realize her ideas. She thanks the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos for its trust in her.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, face powder, talcum powder, lipsticks and nail polish.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 45, is the leader of this group. Growing up in the village of Tup, she defined her future profession early in childhood. Gulmira received a degree in engineering and works as an engine-driver assistant in a cement plant. 

Gulmira has four children. Nothing went wrong until the day when she lost her husband. Then, as the only breadwinner, she had to find ways of supporting the family financially. Three years ago she and her oldest son spent their small savings on the purchase of a very first calf. Since then cattle-breeding and reselling brings in at least 2,000 soms a month to the family budget. 

Gulmira, as well as other members of her group, needs financial assistance for a further broadening of the business. Therefore they rely on Kiva lenders. Gulmira plans to spend her own part on the purchase of one more calf for fattening and resale. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan.
