Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz  is 35 years old. He is married with two children.  Seven years ago Chingiz, with his mechanic's skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. With all faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little.

Villagers who use trucks and tractors for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him. Now, Chingiz is finding that the tools and spare parts that he has are not enough to work at his job at full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN. This loan will be used to buy tools and spare parts used to repair autos. With this loan, Chingiz will be able to provide his children with better living conditions and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 20-year-old father who has an infant child. Robert has a motorcycle he uses to give passengers rides. He has been in this business for almost 7 years. 

Robert is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new tires for his motorcycle in order to provide better service. He usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month in this business.

In the future, Robert hopes to have more earnings in order to start another kind of business as a source of income. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist him so he can able to reach his business goals someday.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his motorcycle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es: Sobeida tiene 42 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos y su esposo. Para Soseída el negocio D. la costura y venta D. salchipapas ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado para poder obtener los ingresos necesario y así aportar en la economía del hogar, ella en la costura se dedica a confeccionar sabanas y cubre camas; y por las noches venD. salchipapas en la vereda D. su casa, lleva ya casi 1 año en esta actividad y le va bien ya que le genera buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es poder conversar con sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es tener que salir muy temprano a realizar las compras para las ventas D. comida en las noches. Espera con el tiempo poder remodelar su casa y poder poner ahí un taller más granD.. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Con los 3000 mil soles solicitados comprará telas e hilos, además D. comprar ingredientes para la preparación D. salchipapas.
texts.en: Sobeida, 42, is a kind, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her two children and husband.  For Sobeida, her sewing business and sales of "salchipapas" (sausage and french fries) have been a source of income that has enabled her to contribute to the household expenses.  As a seamstress, she makes bed sheets and bedspreads, and at night sells salchipapas off her front porch.  She has been in business for nearly a year ,and it has done well enough for her to generate a good profit.  What she enjoys most about her job is being able to talk to the customers.  The greatest challenge she has is having to go out early to buy the ingredients for her food sales.  In the future she would like to renovate her home and set up a larger workshop.  This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She plans to use the 3,000 PEN she has requested to buy fabric and thread, as well as ingredients to make her salchipapas.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread, as well as ingredients to make "salchipapas".

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Uganda. She is single with 3 children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells bananas and has been in business for the last 10 years. She sells her bananas at the market and works seven days a week.

Irene has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas and set up a better stall for her products. Aside from her banana business, Irene generates additional income as a part-time teacher at a nearby school. The main business challenges she faces are transportation and seasonality.

Irene lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and to set up a better stall

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a potatoes and water vending business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing potatoes and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor keeps livestock and an orchard and cultivates land. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is not enough to cover their daily costs. With the requested loan Grigor plans to purchase fuel and seeds. With the help of this loan Grigor will successfully cultivate the land and develop agriculture. This will help him to insure better living conditions for his family. Grigor lives together with his wife and two sons.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and seeds

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONA”; Situado a 10 minutos del mismo poblado de Urubamba, perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Elsa; tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 5, 1 años de edad, La socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, para  la venta la socia cría chanchos, ovejas, gallinas, cuyes para criar, reproducirlos y venderlos, la socia desea invertir este crédito en la copra de chanchos, ovejas y gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores en esta ocasión comprara chanchos 2, ovejas, 4 y gallinas, 6.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera disciplinada el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
This member belongs to Las Flores de Yanacona communal bank, which is located 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Elsa is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children ages 9, 5 and 1 year old. She raises small animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens and guinea pigs to reproduce and sell them. She wants to use this loan to purchase pigs, sheep and chickens, specifically 2 pigs, 4 sheep and 6 chickens.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan provided and is committed to continue making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase small animals, specifically 2 pigs, 4 sheep and 6 chickens.

loans.name: Zoraida Genoveva

texts.es:
Zoraida ahora de 61 años está muy contenta porque ha podido mejorar su vivienda en la parte delantera y pudo así mejorar los ingresos de su negocio ya que ella sigue trabajando como peluquera y ahora dando masajes.   

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir creciendo personalmente y seguir con mayores ingresos para su familia. Ahora el prestamo lo quiere para construir otra parte de la casa que es un nuevo piso. para que su peluqueria quede con toda la parte de abajo de su casa y asi sus clientes tengan mas espacio. Comprar cemento, zinc etc.
texts.en:
Zoraida is now 61 years old.  She is very happy because she has been able to improve the front part of her home and thereby improve her income from her business.  She continues working as a hairdresser and now provides massages too. 

Zoraida has many aspirations to continue growing on a personal level and to continue making more income for her family.  She would like this loan to build another part of her home (a new floor) so that her hairdressing salon takes up the whole of the downstairs of her home and her customers will have more space.  She will buy cement, metal sheets, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sheets of metal, cement and sand

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and happily living with her husband and two children. Analyn is engaged in a retailing business, which is a sari-sari store. She sells snack foods, breads, beverages, candies, and spices. Analyn has been in this business for 13 years. Aside from the sari-sari store business, she also operates a van for hire for passenger transportation.
Analyn’s sari-sari store business is a big help for her and to her family because the profit from her business is used for the daily allowances of her children. She has low income for now because some of her customers did not pay for her products in cash. Her customers have not paid for their credit. 
With her desire to gain higher income, Analyn is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy additional commodities like canned goods, medicines, diapers, and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities like canned goods, medicines, diapers, and beauty products.

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en: Meresi is a 45-year-old widow with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in salted fish for three years; she was initially in the produce business. Her hardships are seasonal variations and insufficient capital. Her vision is a bigger and more stable business, plus educating her children. Meresi needs a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is married. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and every month she earn 8,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Medelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Medelyn hopes to have her children finish their studies and to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 34 años, convive con su pareja hace 10 años, con la que crían a 3 hijos menores de 8 años. Esta familia vive en el Barrio de Santo Domingo en el distrito de Tapo. Walter se dedica a la agricultura, en los terrenos de cultivo que se ubican en su propia comunidad siembra: arvejas, habas y papas, productos que negocia los días de feria en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Sus cosechas se venden al instante y son trasladados a la ciudad de Lima, en su mayoría, por compradores que viajan hasta la zona. De esa manera ha podido mantener a su joven familia y darles a sus hijos una educación decente en la escuela de su comunidad. “Si conviene trabajar en la tierra, pero hay días de pérdidas también, por ejemplo hace 5 años perdí 2 hectáreas de papas por culpa del hielo”, explica, advirtiendo que gracias a ese problema aprendió a cuidar sus cultivos con más tenacidad. Walter espera, con el tiempo extender sus terrenos y abarcar más sembríos. Así también anhela brindarles a sus pequeños hijos la educación que él, por falta de dinero no pudo acceder. “Mis hijos son lo más valioso que puedo tener, por ellos seguiré trabajando”, menciona. Éste sería su préstamo número 8 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. A la vez agradece a la entidad y a su banco comunal por la oportunidad de crecimiento que le muestran en el camino. Con el dinero del crédito, Walter comprará semillas de papas y bolsas de abonos. Calcula que no pasará de 2000 soles, con lo que le sobre pagará el servicio de transporte y mano de obra; todo esto para la próxima cosecha de mayo.
texts.en: Walter is 34 years old. He has lived with his spouse for 10 years and together they are raising three children under 8. This family lives in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in the Tapo district. Walter works in agriculture on cropland located in his own community. He plants peas, beans and potatoes, products that he sells on market days in the wholesalers' market in Tama. His crops sell right away and most are taken to the city of Lima for buyers who travel to that area. In this way, he has been able to support his young family and give his children a decent education in their community's school. " It's good to work the earth, but there are days with losses too. For example, 5 years ago, I lost 2 hectares of potatoes due to frost", he explains. He notes that thanks to that problem he learned to take care of his crops more tenaciously. Walter hopes to in time expand his land and plants more crops. He also wants to give his young children the education that he, due to lack of money, had no access to. "My children are the most valuable thing I can have. For them I will keep working", he remarks. This would be his 8th loan with MFP. For this is reason, he is committed to making his payments on time. At the same time, he is grateful to the organization and to his communal bank for the growth opportunity they have shown him along the way. With the money from the loan, Walter will buy potato seed and sacks of fertilizer. He calculates that it won't be more than 2000 soles, and with what is left over he will pay for the transportation service and labor costs. This is all for his next crop in May.

loans.use: to buy seeds and sacks of fertilizer as well as hire workers and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Don Ramon labora como guarda de seguridad, pues ha mantenido su trabajo, y gracias a estos tambien su vida familiar ha mejorado al poder dar mejores comodidad de vivienda.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para hacer divisiones de cuarto,comprara materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra, dando a sus hijos, seguridad y privacidad, ya que no cuenta con esta mejora que es de relevancia para todos. El cual el va poco ah poco haciendo posible esto, ya que son muchos gastos que cubrir, y que tiene que cumplir y mejorar como padre responsable de la familia.
texts.en:
Don Ramon works as a security guard.  He has kept his job and thanks to this his family life has improved as he is able to make improvements to his residence.
This new loan is for making dividers for the rooms.  He will buy construction materials and will begin the work which will give more security and privacy for his children.  He does not currently have the privacy that is important to everyone.  He is slowly making this possible, the expenses and improvements that he has to cover as a responsible father of a family are many.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build room dividers providing more privacy for his family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and married with one child.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Victoria aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 24-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children, ages one and four. Neither of them goes to school. 

For one year, Faiza has run a small hotel business. She has no employees. Faiza heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach, and promotion by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 500 to purchase cassava flour, meat, beans and many other food items. Apart from this business, Faiza has no other source of income.

In five years, Faiza would like to enlarge her her small hotel.

Her home expenses are a major challenge.

Faiza says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support of helping her with some capital for supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as cassava flour, meat, and beans.

loans.name: Tolobubu

texts.ru:
Толобубу 60 лет, пенсионерка. Основным источником дохода для Толобубу является животноводство, начатое ею в 2009 году.  Стартовав свой бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), она смогла развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 5,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толобубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы Толобубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Tolobubu is 60 years old, and is retired. Her chief source of income is animal husbandry, which she began in 2009. Starting with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), she has been able to grow her business to where it brings in a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Tolobubu has gone to Bai Tushum & Partners to request a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase more sheep. Tolobubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La sra. Herminia tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el barrio el porvenir de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, todos los dias se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, cuando termina la elaboracion de las tortillas sale a venderlas a lugares cercanos de su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus tortillas son grandes y sabrosas.
Herminia es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad, la meta de Herminia es graduar a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
Herminia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
En sus tiempos libres Herminia y su familia visitan la iglesia.
El credito lo invertira en  compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia, 36, lives in the Porvenir neighborhood in the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living.  Every day she gets up at 4:30 a.m. to begin production.  When she has finished making the tortillas she goes out to sell them near her home.  She has many customers because her tortillas are large and delicious.

Herminia is the mother of four children who study at the community educational center.  Herminia's goal is for her children to graduate and become good professionals.  Her husband helps cover household expenses.  In her free time, Herminia and her family go to church.

She plans to use the loan to buy corn, firewood, quicklime and water.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, quicklime and water.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rugiatu, a small scale businesswoman in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.  Rugiatu sells medicines and packet water.  She has been a businesswoman for eight years now. 

The thirty-nine year old has requested for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL.  With the help of this loan, she will buy more drugs/medicines to add to her pharmacy. Born in Makeni city, Rugiatu is divorced, with two children who are attending primary schools.

loans.use: To buy more drugs/medicines to add to her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold is 48 years old and lives with his wife, named Tuya, and three children in a ger district of Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife his conductor. His older daughter and son is college student. Since 2008, He conducted a public transport business.  He needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the equipment fuel economy for his microbus. Mr.Ganbold's goal is to increase the profit and to save the money for his children's higher education.

loans.use: To purchase the equipment fuel economy for his microbus

loans.name: Romelle

texts.en:
Romelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her internet cafe business.

Romelle successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Romelle's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Even though Nancy grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Nancy is an entrepreneur. She sells smoked fish and yams in Wegbe (near Hohoe). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their only child and two other dependents. Nancy has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase bunches of yams and different types of smoked fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nancy wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her dependents and her only child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of yams and different types of smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
K. Thon would like to provide her family with a safe and comfortable place to live. Right now the home for her family of five is small and in poor condition. She is requesting a loan of $500 in order to make repairs and improve their home. 

K. Thon works hard as a tailor and typically earns about $1.25 per day. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver, and he earns about $3 dollars a day. Her oldest daughter also contributes to the family income through her work at a local factory. She earns a salary of $80 per month from the factory. K. Thon's younger son and daughter are both currently attending school. K. Thon is eager to make these improvements on their home, and feels that she will be able to better care for her family as a result of this loan.

loans.use: Repair and improve home.

loans.name: Idaya

texts.en: Idaya is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993 and started her business in 1999. In 2000-2006 she borrowed 6 loans from Normicro Baku branch totaling $5000. Now she would like  to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar has owned his business for four years. "My shop is very small and I would like to expand it a little bit because right now some customers have to wait outside while I attend to others. I would like $1200 to expand my shop."

Translated from Spanish by Alexis Hult, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Cesar tiene su negocio desde hace 4 años. “Mi negocio es muy pequeño y me gustaría ampliarlo un poco ya que a veces la gente tiene que esperar afuera para que salga la gente que estoy atendiendo debido al espacio tan reducido que tengo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar mi negocio.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Hilda sells groceries and house supplies in a main street of her community. This business is located in her own home, after she conditioned a part of it to serve this purpose. She started the business with the help of her husband, who lended her money to start.

Loan Usage

Hilda wants to use the loan to invest in purchasing more groceries and to remodel the aspect of her locale. She wants to paint the walls of her shop and put up a bigger door so she can better service her customers.

Personal Information

Hilda is 50 years old and has three children, all whom are grown up. Her house is made of cement and is in a strategic place in town. Her goal is to have a well-conditioned locale to be able to offer the best service possible to her clients, and to improve her quality of life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Hilda tiene a la venta víveres y abarrotes en una calle principal de su sector. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en un local que acondicione dentro de su propia casa. Empezo su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quien le presto el dinero para comenzar

Uso del Préstamo

Hilda tiene pensado invertir el prestamo en la compra de mas mercaderia mejorar el aspecto de su local enluciendo las paredes y ampliando en ingreso al local con una puerta mas grande para poder atender de mejor forma asus clientes.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 50 años y tres hijos que ya son mayores su vivienda es de cemento y esta en un sitio estrategico. Su objetivo es de tener un local acondicionado para atender bien al público y con ello poder mejorar sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries and remodeling her locale

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en:
Shahmurad A. is a 52-year-old farmer who lives with his five children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Varkhakend village of the Saatli region. Shahmurad sells dairy products to the local and capital traders and has been doing it since 1996, when he purchased his first milk cow with saved money. Shahmurad and his wife make yoghurt at their home and sell it to the local people. It brings them good income and that is enough to cover family needs.

Currently Shahmurad has two cows, but conditions to keep the cattle are very bad. Shahmurad has applied for 1000 USD to put a new roof on the cattle shed.

loans.use: Create better conditions for keeping cattle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad owns a grocery store in the Laylaki region, a suburb of Beirut. He is 50 years old and is a father of 3 children. Now that the school year has started, Ahmad needs a loan of 1200$ to be able to buy more merchandise and to be able expand his business so that he will be able to pay his children's tuition. Ahmad has come to a point where he is seriously planning to grow his business and a loan is a first step towards his goal.

loans.use: to buy more mechandise for the grocery shop and pay the children's tuition fees

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and is raising her son on her own. She supports herself with a small business selling women’s clothing at the bustling outdoor central market in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Starting her own business and becoming a market vendor was the best option Galina had when she needed to earn money. She has been selling now for five years. In a typical month she makes about $600 in profit. Galina hopes to expand her business in the future by opening another sales location. For many market vendors like Galina, opening additional sales kiosks is the best way to increase their overall income and help ensure long-term sustainability.

Galina has requested a six month loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory. This loan will help Galina meet customer demands and make a good profit over the busy year-end season.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with one child. She and her family live in Ordzhonikidze. Nina runs a small business in the central city market selling clothing. Her vending spot is well-known for having a wide variety of inventory. The assorted trendy clothing items that Nina offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Nina has been in this business for one year. Currently, she has about US$ 14,000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 700.

Nina’s hard work is – plain and simple – the engine that drives her success. She is also very consistent in her business planning. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to open a new vending spot and expand her business venture. One of Nina’s long-term plans is to launch her own start-up business manufacturing and selling clothing which will allow her to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot for clothing

loans.name: Erick Daniel

texts.es:
Erick, 28, is married and has a 3-year old son. His wife is a homemaker and they live in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua, a very poor neighborhood where people live on $2 a day. From the time Erick was 14-years old, he's worked in his father's business and over the years, he's moved up there so that he's now the manager of the business, Empresa Inmobiliaria Oriental. (An "inmobiliaria" is a realty company.)

Erick has been building his house and has already built a wall for it but, due to a lack of funds, it's only been finished in concrete. To make it more secure, he wants to reinforce it with iron (bars?) so he's applying for a loan with which he'll buy the iron (bars?) and other materials that he needs to finish the work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Erick tiene 28 años, es casado, con un niño de 3 años de edad, su esposa cuida del niño y es ama de casa, habitan en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, barrio muy pobre donde los pobladores viven con $2 dólares al día. Erick desde los 14 años trabaja en el negocio de su padre, con los años ha ido progresando y hoy en dia es Responsable de Bodega y Fiscal de Proyecto de la Empresa Inmobiliaria Oriental.

Erick ha ido construyendo su casa, anteriormente construyó el muro delantero de la misma, pero debido al poco dinero con que contaba para realizar esta construcción la hizo sólo de concreto, hoy en día quiere asegurarla metiendole hierro al muro, es para eso que requeire del crédito para poder comprar el hierro y demás materiales necesarios para hacer esta obra.

loans.use: Security wall for house.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar Davlatovich N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 57 years old, is married and has 8 children. He has a specialized secondary education. He is a professional driver and also is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40-45 days and then sells them at higher price, since grown calves are cost more and are used for meat. He then buys another set of young calves, feeds them and resells them. This is his business, which helps him to provide for his family, since he is a sole breadwinner of the family. Besides that, the development of stock-raising business allows to supply nearby markets with fresh meat at affordable prices. Safar has been in this business for about 20 years. He wants to use the proceeds of his loan to purchase several calves. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Нуралиев Сафар Давлатович житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 57 лет, женат, имеет 8 детей.Образование средне специальное. По специальности водитель. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 дней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки стоят дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 20 лет.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погаситькредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Nea

texts.en: Mrs. Nea S., age 26, is married with two children and works on her field as a farmer. On average, she makes about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kon Saroeun, 31, has business milling rice for the local farmers. With his rice grinding mill he takes the husks off the rice. In revenue, he earns $10 a day. The couple have 2 children, one is a student and the other is too young to attend school. This couple has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to assist on their field. They will also rent it to the local villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to assist on the farmland.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang L. is a housewife living in Kampong Cham. She cares for a household of five including her husband, their two children, and her elderly father. Her husband, Thai Deng, buys recyclable items from people at their home and then sells these to local factories that will put them to use. He has developed this low income business surprisingly well to the point where he can make 5 US$ per day depending on how many items he is able to secure. Their children are all too young to attend school.

She wants to take out a loan specifically to help her husband increase his business by buying a greater quantity of recyclable items. They can stockpile these to sell to support their family in months when his business has not been as profitable as it usually is.

loans.use: To buy recyclable items in bulk.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: Shahnaz is 35 years old, just five years younger than her husband.  His name is L. A. and he is an expert in making flower pots. Shahnaz wants a loan of $725 for her husband’s business so that he can expand his business and buy more materials.  She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Majidan wants a loan to repair her van; Rubina wants a loan to expand her flower pot business; Munawar wants a loan to buy a donkey cart.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Kati Escarleth

texts.es:
Katy B. works in the production and selling of delicious platters which she sells in the city of Chinandega, where is originally from. With a lot of effort, she has managed to improve the conditions of her business and she has dreams of becoming a great merchant in her food market.

She has come to Ceprodel to request a necessary loan for the purchase raw ingredients to prepare her platters. That's why she hopes that the loan will be provided since this business is her only means of support to maintain her household, which is composed of her and her two small children that she dearly loves.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Katy B. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosos platillos los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por lo que son sus sueños convertirse en una gran comerciante en su mercado de alimentos.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos. Por esta razón es que espera que el crédito será otorgado ya que al elaborar y vender los alimentos, este es el único sustento para mantener su hogar compuesto por ella y dos pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food products

loans.name: Mersija

texts.en:
Mersija is a 33 year old woman from Tojsici, a small village outside the town Kolesija. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 13 years old. Mersija and her husband run a small convenience store. Like many Bosnians, Mersija also practices subsistence farming—growing food in her home garden to feed her family. She and her husband also raise cattle and breed poultry to earn additional income.

For her first loan from Zene za Zene, Mersija has requested 1000 KM. Part of this loan she will use to buy more chickens to fatten and sell, and the rest she will use to purchase additional inventory for her small shop. Mersijia hopes these investments will increase their overall family income. With two growing kids it seems their expenses go up every year, and she wants to make sure their earnings can keep up.

loans.use: To buy chickens and other goods to increase the inventory of her convenience store.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia started her business in order to earn enough income to pay for her expenses because she was unable to find a job. Since she has always liked retail, she decided to start selling denim apparel three years ago in the street markets. Her business is currently prosperous.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a protective structure for the denim stand that she has in the market, thus allowing her to protect herself from inclement weather.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yesenia inició el negocio para tener una actividad que le diera un ingreso para pagar sus gastos por que no conseguía trabajo y como siempre le han gustado las ventas decidió hace tres años empezar a vender ropa de mezclilla en los tianguis ropa y actualmente le va bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estructura para el puesto de ropa que tiene en los mercados y así poder protegerse de las inclemencias del tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase protective structure

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil M., 35, is married and has two children. He is a policeman in the Bilasuvar region where is living now. His main financial income comes from selling dairy products as milk and yoghurt to the local people and factories. He started his business in 1999 when his family conditions were very bad and his salary wasn't enough to purchase the necessary food products. With the help of his relatives, he built a good business. But time passed, prices for everything increased, and his business needs to expand. For this purpose Ismayil applied for a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: to purchase two milkier cows

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Happy R. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 7. Happy has established a store that sells traditional clothing called kanga and vitenge, which is worn by Tanzanian women. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. 

Happy buys the clothing wholesale and resells it at retail prices. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by her husband. She currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase additional stock of kanga and vitenge. Happy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase kanga and vitenge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medical instruments, a microscope, a refrigerator, and a TV for the waiting room.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly B. lives in San Isidro Quirino, Isabela with his wife Barbara and their four year old son Rolando. His wife stays at home and takes good care of their son. Rolly spends his days working on their farm. Most of the residents in San Isidro Quirino are farmers; the major crops are rice, tobacco and corn.

Rolly manages a three hectare corn field and a half hectare rice field. Due to the prevailing crisis in agriculture, he lacks the financial capital to continue cultivating his farm. Since the farm is their only source of living, Rolly is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to increase his working capital. He hopes that his income will increase so that he can save for the education of his son.

Rolly dreams for a better life someday. He is very confident and believes that he can fulfill his dream.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Leemo

texts.en: Leemo T., 40, is married with one child.  She has three years of experience selling elei and printing materials. She sells to regular clients as well as to family and friends three days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (about US$270).  SPBD loans are Leemo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband also works and helps her financially when business is slow.

loans.use: To buy paintings, brushes, stencils, carving wood, and materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 39-year-old married man with three children, living in Harouf, southern Lebanon. Ali used to work in a shop selling and fixing tires since 1990; three years ago he took a loan from Ameen and opened his own shop. Today, Ali wants to increase his tire inventory; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000.

loans.use: Buy more inventory for his shop

loans.name: Kassum

texts.en: Kassum A. sells used clothing at Abura. Kassum has received primary level education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Kassum has been selling used clothing for about 2 years. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family's other financial needs. Her loan will be used to as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest for the expansion of  her little business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing

loans.name: Thi Xuyen

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Xuyên  năm nay 61 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Gia đình  chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn  với thu nhập 2.000.000/tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 20 con lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi Xuyen, 61 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2006. She has 3 grown-up children. Currently, her family mostly relies on rearing pigs for a monthly income of 2 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase animal feeds and 20 more pigs to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pigs

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri (3 mariées et une célibataire) sont  âgées de 18 à 45 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes viennent de commencer le  partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe  et sont unies par des liens de voisinage.
Le présent prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 kg de poudre de gombo. Les femmes s’approvisionnent avec les paysannes des villages environnants de Bougouni. Les achats sont faits  pendant les jours de foire. Cette poudre de gombo (qui est un condiment alimentaire entrant dans la préparation de beaucoup de sauces au Mali et même en Afrique de l’ouest) sera reconditionnée, mise dans des petits emballages et vendu à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
De ce commerce les femmes du groupe espèrent  gagner en moyenne 15.000FCFA par mois. Avec cette marge bénéficiaire elles  remboursent l’échéance du prêt et font face également à quelques dépenses de la famille (éducation des enfants, santé et habillement surtout).
texts.en:
The women of the Tièssiri group (3 married and one single) are between 18 and 45, with on average 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have just begun their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan and are united through the fact that they are neighbors.

This loan will be used to buy 30 kg of powdered okra. The women buy their merchandise from the farm women in the villages surrounding Bougouni. They do their buying on market days. This powdered okra (which is a condiment used in the preparation of many sauces in Mali and indeed in all of West Africa) will be reconditioned, put into small packets, and sold in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali).

From this business, the women of this group hope to make on average 15,000 F CFA per month. With this profit, they will repay the loan and also cover some expenses for their families (education of their children, health, and clothing above all).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of powdered okra

loans.name: Dédé Ameme

texts.fr: Cette dame vit dans le quartier de lomnava, un quartier au centre de la ville de Lomé avec ses deux enfants. Pour subvenir à ses propres charges et à celles de ses enfants elle a entamé la vente de boisson locale appelée « sodabi », elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’agoè. Le sodabi est une boisson alcoolisée qui est très appréciée au togo. Son stock étant épuisé elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 12 bidons de Sodabi.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in Lomnava, a district in downtown Lomé, with her two children. To support herself and her children, she started selling a local drink called “sodabi”. She gets her supplies at the local marketplace of Agoè. Sodabi is an alcoholic beverage that is highly appreciated in Togo. Her stock being exhausted, she’s requesting a loan for buying 12 containers of sodabi.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: B. Aisha, 49, is the leader of Victoria group in Lugazi. She is a widow with 5 children aged 13-30 years. One of her children is already out of school. The others are in school, all candidate classes. She also cares for 6 dependants. She has enrolled them all into a Government school but helps to clothe, feed, pay medical bills and buy them books and school uniforms. Aisha has a restaurant business that has been functional for 3 years and fully serviced using loans from Pearl Microfinance. Her business is doing well because of the way she handles her customers. As a result of her success and reputation, she also won a tender to supply food for a fishing company in Katosi, her business location. Aisha has a dream of one day building her own house that can accommodate her restaurant business so that she can give the restaurant room for expansion and she can also stop renting.

loans.use: Buying food supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Josephine M.. She is 35 years old and married with six children, ages 2, 5, 9, 11, 13, and 14. She also cares for one orphan of 23 years of age. Josephine and her family live in the Nyarugenge district of the city of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur owns a charcoal store in the Nyarugenge district. She started her business in 2002 and she earns a monthly profit of approximately $275. She has one full-time employee who helps her in her business. In addition, her husband earns a monthly income of about $365. Mrs. Musabyiman opens her shop at 6 a.m. and closes at 8 p.m. every day.

She is seeking her first loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. She plans to expand her business venture and intends to reinvest increased profits back into her business.

loans.use: To expand her venture and reinvest in her business

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia R. D. M. D. 58 años D. edad, redice en Cojutepeque, departamento D. Cuscatlán.  Vive únicamente junto a su esposo José M. D. 60 años D. edad. La señora Juana posee desD. hace 20 años una pupusería; negocio a través del cual ha logrado solventar todos sus gastos durante muchos años. Juana solícita un préstamo a través D. cual pueda mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, comprar más materia prima por mayor, tales como maíz, frijoles, arroz,  entre otros más, así D. esta manera ella espera mejorar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia R. D. M. is 58 years old and resides in the Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband José M. who is 60 years old. Juana has owned a pupuseria (a food stand that serves pupusas, a stuffed thick tortilla like El Salvadorian dish) for 20 years; through this business she had been able to settle her expenses for many years. Juana is requesting a loan through which she will be able to improve her business’ condition, and purchase basic materials wholesale, such as corn, beans, rice, and other. In this way she hopes to improve her business, and obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and their three children in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a small restaurant for twenty years where he creates traditional Lebanese cooking like hummos (made from chickpeas) and ful (made from fava beans).

Ali requested a loan of 2500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his resaurant like vegetables, raw materials and drinks. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and he sells a good quality product. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his restaurant

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 23-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 6 and 2.

Sikudhani started her own wholesale business 3 years ago. She works 5 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 70,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Sikudhani’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sikudhani hopes to pay school fees, save money, to do repairs, get more food for family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella has two children, one of whom is adopted. She is separated from her husband and bringing up the two children is quite challenging.

With such a huge financial obligation, Isabella started selling clothes from her house and hawking them (going door-to-door) on the weekends. She moves from one door to another in the expansive Mumias sugar complex. She sources her merchandise from the neighboring country, Uganda. Recently she also added shoes as part of her stock.

In order to boost her income, Isabella also prepares chapatis (flat bread) in her house and sells them to the factory workers. Isabella is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
I. Munavar is 59 years old. She is married and has one son. Munavar's husband works for a charitable organization as an accountant. In order to support her husband, Munavar has been running her own business for more than nine years. She sells national trousers for women. National dresses and trousers in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item for the majority of women and girls. Munavar has a trading place in the central local markets of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods available, in order to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different income levels. Today, Munavar requests 800 USD for the purpose of increasing the variety of her goods for sale. Be an important part of the growth of Munavar's business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new national trousers for women in order to increase the range of goods available for sale

loans.name: Nornie

texts.en:
Nornie D. owns a 1-hectare (~2.5 acre) rice field. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 26 years old  and wants to study in college. Nornie helps her husband to till their rice farm. When they are not busy on the farm, they visit their fish pond, which is their additional source of income. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fish food and rice seeds. Land preparation is also expensive and the loan will definitely help pay the laborers who prepared the field for planting.

She joined in CEVI program last 2008 and she said, “ CEVI services really helped my family to finance our businesses”.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Chourng

texts.en:
Chourng N., 55, is a widow and resides with one of her children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is involved in the business of purchasing silk from people who produce silk in her village and other nearby places, earning US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently working in a local garment factory with an income of US $3 per day.

Chourng N. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more silk to resell for more income. In the photo, she is happily preparing Cambodian traditional cakes during the biggest religious ceremoN. in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en: 38-year-old Lorenda G. is a rice farmer. She is married and has two children, with the eldest being 13 years old. Lorenda owns rice fields and some of her crops are already flowering while some are only a month old. Short of finances, she requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will be used to purchase the items Lorenda needs for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase items needed for the farm

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin J. is in the business of selling local alcohol from home and is requesting a loan to purchase more firewood for continuous distillation.  Martin is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a director. She has eight children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more firewood for continuous distillation

loans.name: Chan Sopha

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Sopha U. is a villager in Doem Rom Del village in Takeo province. She is a middle woman in the rice business. Her husband, Mr. Huong Soeu, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have money to pay for plowing. Thus, Mrs. Chan Sopha U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the rice field. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are farmers and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Armando Anreasse

texts.pt:
Armando Andreasse Manombo nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, tem 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 10 filhos cuja idade já não se lembra, 3 destes vão a escola. Fez somente 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e ainda sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Marracuene para o Distrito de Boane a muitos anos trás com a sua família a procura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha como operador de máquinas pesadas numa pedreira desde 1961 e tem um salário mensal de 4.600.00mt que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua própria casa. A esposa faz venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, como forma de incrementar a receita familiar.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos, e este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.00,00mt e 10.000,00mt para comércio e habitação, respectivamente.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhor conforto para a sua família.
texts.en:
Armando Andreasse Manombo was born in the district of Marracuene in the province of Maputo. He is 59, married, and the father of 10 children whose ages he doesn't remember. Three of his children go to school. He only studied through 4th grade of the old education system and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports 2 grandchildren that live with him.

He left Marracuene for the district of Boane many years ago with his family in search of better living conditions. He has worked as a heavy equipment operator in a quarry since 1961 and makes a monthly salary of 4,600 meticais. He uses this money to pay for his family's expenses and still saves some at his house. His wife sells basic products as a way of increasing their family's income.

He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends. This is his 3rd loan, and it is for 10,000 meticais. He will use it to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, etc) to finish building his home. His previous loans were for 5,000 and 10,000 meticais and were used for his business and his home, respectively.

In the future, he would like to request more laons to finish his home and to offer more comfort to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita T. makes her living by operating a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. She sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. Juanita is 29 years old and comes from the village of Sto. Niño in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has two school-aged children.

In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.

Juanita is requesting a new loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay the tuition of her two children..

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell from her food stall

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie, 32 years old, is a married woman. She has three children, and her oldest is only seven years old. She has dreams for her family, especially her children. She wants all of them to have a proper education and a bright future.

Working at her farm can be very tiring, but Hydie keeps herself strong enough so that she can still take care of her family. She and her husband work hand-in-hand in doing farming chores. Their farm is now being prepared for planting.

Hydie requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies needed at their farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Moses Ole

texts.en:
Moses is married to Esther and they have six children.

Moses was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he is servicing his first loan. Moses has been in the business of selling livestock for twenty four years. He intends to use this loan to buy more sheep. He will fatten them and sell them for profit. His other sources of income are selling herbs and precious stones.

Moses operates his business within a market in his area of residence. With the extra profits, Moses will buy a piece of land and build rental houses. Moses  wants to educate his six children and establish a family business. 

He describes himself as loyal and hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to puchase sheep which he will fatten and then resell for profit.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
ClotilD. es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
ClotilD. es viuda, tiene 66 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, ClotilD. venD. alfalfa, verduras D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
ClotilD. necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
texts.en:
ClotilD. is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. She is a 66 year old widow with 9 children, 6 of whom live with her. ClotilD. is a strolling vendor and sells alfalfa and other produce in the food market every day. ClotilD. needs a loan of 450 soles, which she will use to purchase alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of alfalfa

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. N. is 37 years old, single and has one child who is five years old. Grace's business is located at Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Grace has been selling fruit, such as mangoes, oranges, passion fruits, etc., for the past five years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is harassment by the local government. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Grace is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to expand her business. She hopes to have another business that is totally different from what she currently does. She also hopes to educate her child to university level, buy a plot of land, and build a house for her family. She is hardworking, God fearing and friendly.

loans.use: To expand her food vending business by buying sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Megy

texts.es:
Megy es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Megy es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Megy se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a tiendas y también en el mercado.
Megy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, levadura y azúcar.
Los sueños de Megy son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y horno, comprar un carro para repartir sus productos.
texts.en:
Megy is a member of Iris Communal Bank. Megy is 29 years old and she and her partner have 1 son. Megy is dedicated to the production of typical regional breads, which she bakes in a rented oven. The breads are sold in stores as well as the local market. Megy needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of flour, yeast and sugar. Megy's dreams are to buy land for the construction of her house and oven and to buy a car to distribute her products.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 43 years old and married with three children who go to school. She sells construction materials such as sand, ballast, and bricks to earn a living. She uses her money together with her husband’s earnings to provide for her  family and pay school fees for her children. She previously ran a green grocery. She hopes to build her family a house and to offer better education to her children in the future. She has requested a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of building materials.

loans.use: To purchase cement, ballast and bricks

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda P. is from the village of D. V., Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luzviminda is married and has seven school-aged children. To earn a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Luzviminda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena, tiene 34 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos (Luisa de 10 años y Yoshiro de 4 años), ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la distribución de productos como por ejemplo papa, maíz, habas, ella distribuye sus productos tres veces a la semana al mercado central del Cusco llamado “San Pedro”. Sus actividades económicas complementarias son la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, chanchos, gallinas, patos y cuyes. Primero los cría, los alimenta y después los vende en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Ella también se dedica a la producción de queso 

Rosa Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar animales como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y conejos. 

Rosa Elena se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.  

Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa.  (En la fotografía Rosa esta acompañada de su hijo Yoshiro)
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children (Luisa aged 10 and Yoshiro aged 4 years). She lives in the Inquilpata area of the Anta district in the town of Cusco. Her main line of work is in the selling of produce, for example, potatoes, corn, beans, and she does this three times a week in Cusco’s main market, called ‘San Pedro’. Complementary lines of work in which she is involved include the purchasing, raising, and selling of small animals such as sheep, pigs, chickens, ducks and guinea pigs. Rosa Elena raises the animals and then sells them at Inquilpata-Anta’s Local Country Community Fair on Fridays. She is also involved in cheese production. Rosa Elena is a hard working entrepreneur who tries to make the most of things on a daily basis, and help her family. She requires a loan to purchase more animals such as sheep, guinea pigs and rabbits. Rosa Elena is thankful for the opportunity provided by this loan and is committed to the loan repayment terms. She belongs to the community bank ‘Virgen María de Inquilpata’ of the Arariwa Association. (Photograph shows Rosa accompanied by her son, Yoshiro)

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa Elena is requesting the loan in order to purchase animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, and rabbits.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells foodstuffs like yams, plantains, vegetables and fruits. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has been in this business for long. 

She needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell

loans.name: Kasanja Basooka Kwavula, Mubende Group

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is K. Isaaya, the group leader. He also appears in the group photo.

A determined and very hard working K. Isaaya, aged 47 years, is the married father of ten children and three helpless dependents. He has operated a retail shop business for sixteen years in Kibutamu, Mubende District, selling general merchandise. At the end of every week he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from his shop and 150,000 shillings from farming.

Isaaya’s main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in his business that cannot match the consumption rate of his customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods to satisfy his customers’ high demand and also transform his enterprise into a wholesale business in future.

Being very committed to his business, with good customer care, Isaaya hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business and enable him to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kimsreng Tuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Krapeu Ha-I village in Kandal province. E. member will use his or her portion of the loan for different business improvement purposes. 

Mrs. Kimsreng T., age 49, is the village bank president selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Theng, offer tailoring services out of their hoM.. This allows thE. to earn money to support their family. Since their business is going well, they want to expand their services. 

In order to improve their business, Mrs. Kimsreng T. is seeking a loan to buy fabric to make clothes for their customers. They have two children, one of whom is a beautician. The other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes for their customers

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en: Muqaddas S. is a 47 year old man who has been selling different kinds of food in his own shop since 2007. He is married and has three children. Muqaddas`s monthly income is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose, he applied for 600 AZN and will use this loan to buy more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to increase his income.

loans.name: Jesus Cristobal

texts.es:
Jesús de 46 años, es mecánico y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), tiene tres hijos y su esposa es profesora de una escuela. 

Para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde joven como mecánico, con esfuerzo a podido construir su casa y mantener a su familia, ahora también esta trabajando como conserje en sus ratos libes para tener mas ingresos. 

Para construir mejor su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y arena. En el futuro el quiere aumentar su casa con un segundo piso y así darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 46 years old and works as a mechanic. He lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem). Jesús has three children and his wife works as a schoolteacher.

Due to the lack of opportunities he faced as a young man, he had to work as a mechanic in order to support his family. With effort he was able to build a house and provide what his family needed. Now he also works as a janitor in his spare time to earn additional income.

To build the best home he can, Jesús wants to buy cement and sand. In the future, he wants to expand his house by adding a second floor and hopes to provide a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & sand for building his house

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan M. is a 54-year-old married man blessed with twelve children who are all above eighteen years of age.

Nathan is currently a water vendor operating from a kiosk. He has been in this business for the past six years now and this marks his third borrowing from KADET. He wishes to expand the business by building another water kiosk and later use the anticipated profits to renovate the old one. By doing this, Nathan hopes to increase the number of his customers who are mainly residents of Jomvu, Mombasa.

loans.use: To expand his business by building another water kiosk

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, D. 59 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive sola en su casa propia, puesto que hace 7 años falleció su esposo, su única alegría son sus 4 menores hijos con quienes vive y a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que Rita se dedica, es el cultivo D. papa, arveja, zanahoria y maíz. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga D. la venta D. su cosecha, dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, por tal motivo desea sembrar en toda el área D. terreno que posee para así obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos que le ayuD. a combatir D. los insectos.
texts.en:
Rita, 59, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives alone in her own house because her husband passed away 7 years ago. Her only joy is her four youngest children that live with her and for whom she wants to proviD. a better future. Rita is a potato, pea, corn and carrot farmer.
